Furkat is very happy that he will have the opportunity to purchase such a stove. They live in the countryside, and therefore such a choice was necessary to them, so that there is enough wood and coal. Furkat and his family are very thankful to Kiva for the opportunity to realize their plans.

loans.use: to purchase an energy-efficient stove

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Nita  is a 35-year-old married woman with three children. She would like to start growing taro, bananas, and yams to earn a living. Nita has requested a loan to buy new equipment such as a wheelbarrow, a spade, an ax, etc. 

Nita has been a member of SPBD since 2012. She will spend her profits for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy new equipment such as a wheelbarrow, a spade, an ax, etc.

loans.name: Soloau

texts.en: Soloau  is a 22-year-old married woman with one child. She would like to start growing taro, bananas, and yams to earn a living. Soloau has requested a loan to buy new equipment such as a wheelbarrow, a spade, an ax, etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Soloau will spend her profits for her child's school fees.

loans.use: to buy new equipment such as a wheelbarrow, a spade, an ax, etc.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of three young children from Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in a rice farming business for more than seven years now, together with her husband.

Corazon is asking for a loan to buy additional fertilizers and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to improve their farm and their harvest.

In the future, Corazon has hopes of making their business a success and saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Fiaoo

texts.en: Fiaoo is a 36-year-old married woman with five children. She would like to start growing taro, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has requested a loan to buy new equipment such as a wheelbarrow, spade, axe, etc. She became a member of SPBD in 2012. Fiaoo will spend her profits on her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, etc.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira is 42 years old and married with six children.

Mira is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns an income from her general store. Mira requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and medicines for her pigs.

Mira has been raising pigs for 11 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Faletaaga

texts.en: Faletaaga is a 36-year-old married woman with five children. She would like to start growing taro, bananas and yams to earn a living. Faletaaga has requested a loan to buy new equipment such as a wheelbarrow, spade, axe, etc. She became a member of SPBD in 2012. Faletaaga will spend her profits on her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, spade, axe, etc.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luís es viudo, tiene  cinco hijos todos ya casados, vive en alquiler, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Villa Esperanza de la ciudad de El Alto.

El estudió solo hasta el nivel primario; su profesion es chofer asalariado en uno de los  sindicatos de Transportes de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo requiere para cancelar la intervención quirúrgica (operación de vesícula viliar) a la cual se someterá su hija menor, Luis correrá con este gasto por que su hija no tiene los recursos económicos necesarios.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA. El carácter social de esta solicitud califican para que el crédito se canalice a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Luis is a widower.  He has five children who are all married now.  He rents the house where he lives, which is in the Villa Esperanza area of the city of El Alto.

He only has an elementary school education.  He is a salaried driver for the public transportation union in the city of El Alto. 

He needs the loan to pay for surgery (gall bladder operation) for his youngest daughter.  Luis will cover this expense because his daughter does not have the necessary financial resources.

It is the first time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and the first time from Kiva.  The social nature of the request makes the loan eligible to channel through Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's gall bladder operation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase candy at wholesale.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 53 years old and widowed with two children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past 20 years, Dolores has been a farmer who grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been a member of PMPC for almost 12 years.

Dolores is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lagi

texts.en:
Lagi  is a 42-year-old married woman with six children. She would like to start growing produce such as taro, banana, and yams to earn a living. Lagi joined SPBD in 2012.

Lagi is requesting a loan to buy new equipment such as a wheelbarrow, spade, ax, weed sprayer, chemicals and other supplies for her business. She will use the profit from her loan for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, weed sprayer, chemicals, bushknives, and other farming supplies

loans.name: Roger Erberto

texts.es: El Sr. Roger,  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, su panadería  que se encuentra ubicado  en la zona de Chasquipampa,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Roger va a usar este préstamo para la compra de  harina, manteca y levadura por mayor ya quiere incrementar su producción y así satisfacer la demandada de sus clientes, Roger enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia de una panadería que produce en mayor cantidad por la zona y por este motivo el solicito el crédito ya que quiere mejorar su producción, con este crédito mejorara sus ganancias, Roger es una persona joven  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Roger makes a living baking and selling bread. HIs bakery is located in the Chasquipampa neighborhood. This is the first loan he has taken out through the communal bank. He will use the loan to buy flour, shortening and yeast at wholesale price so that he can increase his production and be able to satisfy the demands of his customers. The challenge that Roger faces is competing with other bakeries, specifically a bakery located in the same neighborhood that makes bread for wholesale sales. This is the reason he has requested a loan, so that he can improve his production and it will also allow him to increase his income. Roger is a young man with a strong desire to get ahead. He is happy and  thankful to the communal bank for the support they provide.

loans.use: to buy flour and shortening to use to bake bread.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is a 38-year-old married man and father to six young children. He is from Ubay, Bohol. For the past eight years, Danilo has been a rice farmer who also raises hogs. 

Danilo is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide for his farm along with pigs to raise. He will use his loan to improve his farm and expand his harvest yield. In the future, Danilo dreams of making his business a success and saving money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for his farm along with pigs to raise

loans.name: Maota

texts.en:
Maota is 33 years old and married with five children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. Maota joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

Maota is requesting a loan to buy a frying pan, bags of sugar and flour, cooking oil, tongs, and other supplies to make pancakes. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a frying pan, bags of sugar and flour, cooking oil, tongs, and other supplies to make pancakes

loans.name: Nanelyn

texts.en:
Nanelyn is 36 years old and married with seven children, four of whom are in school. For the past four years, she has operated an abaca-weaving (plant fiber weaving) business in the Philippines. Nanelyn is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nanelyn is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy tools and equipment for her weaving business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for weaving abaca

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is married, with three children. She is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. Lita is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for ten years. 

Lita has requested a loan to purchase feed and to construct a pigpen. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for four years.

loans.use: to purchase feed and to construct a pigpen.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 54 years old and lives in Proper Langcangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is separated, with two children. Editha has a store  that sells a variety of products: softdrinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many others. 

She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy additional inventory for sale. In the future, Editha hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for sale.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is married, with two children. She is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. Raquel is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. Raquel has been doing this for two years. 

She has requested a loan to construct a pigpen. Raquel has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for almost eight years.

loans.use: to construct a new pigpen.

loans.name: Jomavil

texts.en:
Jomavil is 30 years old and married with three children. He lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. For the past 11 months, Jomavil has been selling noodles, canned goods, and other items to earn a living. He earns 12,000 PHP each month and has been a member of PMPC for one year.

Jomavil is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase more noodles, canned goods, and other items. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, canned goods, and other items

loans.name: Shirlita

texts.en:
Shirlita is 31 years old and single with three children. She lives in Pan-ay Diot, Tudela, Philippines. For the past seven years, Shirlita has run a business selling a variety of products. She earns 5,000 PHP each month and has been a member of PMPC for three years.

Shirlita is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan to purchase products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergent, and other items. In the future, she hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergent, and other items

loans.name: Rubirosa

texts.en:
This time, for her sixth loan cycle, Rubirosa is applying for a loan of PHP 11,000 to purchase raw materials for her abaca-weaving business. 

The general store business that she previously supported through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF), Kiva's field partner, continues and provides for Rubirosa and her family with an increase income to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her abaca-weaving business.

loans.name: Conrada

texts.en:
Conrada is 72 years old, married, and has seven adult children.  She is a  farmer from Ubay, Bohol. She has been a rice farmer for more than 50 years together with her husband. 

Conrada is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy rice seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides. With the loan, she will be able to improve their plants and crops thus augmenting their harvest and yield.  In the future, Conrada dreams of expanding their farming business and saving money for future use.

loans.use: to purchase rice seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, who are all currently in school. For the past ten years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her small boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of UGX 2000000 (Ugandan Shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and improve her business and her family's standard of living. Sarah hopes that, in the future, she will be able to sell the best clothes in town. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Sarah, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Daan Doolé Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Daan Doolé regroupe 4 femmes et un homme qui logent le même quartier et qui ce sont rassemblés pour parce que voulant développer leurs activités.
La responsable, madame Awa est une femme âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de famille. Elle fait du commerce et a acquis une expérience de 3 ans dans ce domaine. Elle n’a aucune charge et travaille pour avoir son autonomie financière et ne plus faire recours au crédit.
texts.en:
The lending group of Daan Doolé is made up of four women and one man who live in the same district. They have come together because they all have an interest in developing and expanding their businesses.

The head of the group is named Awa. She is a 40-year-old woman who is married and is a mother. Awa is a merchant and has three years of experience in her field. Awa does not have any dependents and is working towards her financial independence so that she will no longer need to depend on receiving loans.

loans.use: to purchase food products for resale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 49 years old and is married with two children. She lives in Calaran, Calamba. Susan has a business where she makes and sells processed meat. She earns about 2,400 PHP each month and has been a member of PMPC for almost seven years.

Susan is requesting a loan to purchase raw ingredients to make processed meat.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make processed meat

loans.name: Pilarcita

texts.en:
Pilarcita is 49 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. For the past eight years, Pilarcita has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

Pilarcita is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more grocery products to sell. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Jarry Hamilton

texts.es:
Jarry, 31 años de edad, es un  humilde comerciante quien se dedica  al taller de vulcanización y venta de repuesto, padre de 2hijos actualmente están estudiando su primer grado de primaria. El inicio sus actividades a los 28 años, pues necesitaba un medio del cual subsistir. Anteriormente el trabajaba en un taller de vulcanización, el cual adquirió  experiencia y total dominio  del negocio, luego con dinero que tenia ahorrado decidió emprender su propio negocio, con ayuda de su familia, sus expectativas es ampliar su  inventario, para incrementar las ventas y asi obtener mejores ganancias.
Esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar repuesto para bicicletas y carro como llantas, cadena, rines, etc. Su propósito es hacer crecer su negocio con productos que aun no tiene en existencias, sus planes futuros es vender y comprar bicicletas nuevas a un buen precio, de esta manera poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a su clientela
texts.en: Jarry, 31, is a humble businessman who works in a vulcanization workshop and sells spare parts. He is the father of two children who are currently in the first level of primary school. He started this work at age 28, because he needed a way to make a living. Previously, he worked in a vulcanization workshop. He gained experience and total mastery of the business. Then, with the money he had saved, he decided to start his own business with the help of his family. He hopes to expand his inventory in order to increase his sales and make better profits. He is applying for financing to buy spare parts for bicycles and cars, such as tires, chains, rims, etc. His goal is to grow his business with products that he doesn't yet have in inventory. His future plan is to buy and sell new bicycles at a good price. This way, he can offer better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for bicycles and cars, such as tires, chains, rims, etc.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is farmer from Ubay, Bohol. She has four children and has been a farmer for more than 18 years. 

Julieta is requesting a loan to buy additional fertilizer and pesticide for her farm and pay rent for a tractor. She will use her loan to improve her business and her harvest. In the future, Julieta hopes to make her business a success. She also wants to save money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm and pay rent for a tractor

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 48 years old and lives in D'ban, Calamba. She is married with 3 children. 

Josefina has a tailoring business and earns approximately 3,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to purchase clothes and other tailoring tools. Josefina has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and other materials for tailoring

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: As a married mother of six children, Teresita works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients and utensils for her food business. Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for her food business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a 46-year-old farmer from Ubay, Bohol. She is a mother of six children. Delia has been engaged in a rice farming business for more than 20 years now. She works with her husband in tilling their farm lot.

Delia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for the rent for the tractor. With this, they will be able to improve their farm and eventually their harvest and yield. In the future, Delia hopes of making their farming business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay rent for the tractor

loans.name: Roger Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Roger tiene 26 años y es casado con 1 hijo de la edad de 2 años el se dedica a arreglo de zapatos, botas y zapatillas deportivas en su taller  que se encuentran en la zona  San Jorge Este préstamo es el 1 que ha tomado con la institución, El Sr. Roger a usar este préstamo para la compra de una máquina para la costura de zapatos y esmeril y así aumentar su capital de trabajo para su negocio y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir mejorando su trabajo comprando herramientas y maquinaria.
texts.en: Roger is 26 years old and married.  He as a two year old son.  For a living, Roger repairs shoes, boots and trainers in his workshop in the San Jorge area.  This is his first loan with the bank and he will use it to buy a machine for sewing shoes, to buy emery and to increase his working capital for the business.  The profits will be used to continue to improve the business by buying tools and machines.

loans.use: to buy emery and a machine for sewing shoes.

loans.name: Uamsho Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mawazo est vice présidente du le groupement d’affaire Uamsho, elle est divorcée et mère de 5 jeunes enfants. La cliente est vendeuse de Jus local Madrakwa. En plus, elle vend également des denrées alimentaires (tomates, arachides, pomme de terre, haricots, etc.). Elle commença ses micros activités avec le crédit de l’IMF Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 2 bassins de tomates,1 bassin d’arachides, 50 kg de sorgho. La cliente ambitionne améliorer son entreprise. Le défi majeur pour elle, c’est l’insécurité persistante dans les zones d’approvisionnement. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son appui et autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes. Il sied de signaler une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Mawazo is the vice president of the business group Uamsho. She is divorced and the mother of five young children. Mawazo is a vendor of a local juice commonly known as "Madrakwa". In addition, she also sells foodstuffs (tomatoes, peanuts, potatoes, beans, etc.). She started her business with a loan from IMF Hekima.

This new loan will serve to supply Mawazo with two baskets of tomatoes, one basket of peanuts, and 50 kg of sorghum. Mawazo aims to improve her business. Her current challenge is the constant worry that she will run out of her supply of goods. Thus, she is thankful to Hekima for their support and empowerment of women who are small entrepreneurs. It is worth noting that one member of the group is holding her baby.

loans.use: to purchase two baskets of tomatoes, one basket of peanuts, and 50 kg of sorghum.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is married and has ten children. She is 54 years old and lives in Mohon, Aloran Misamis Occidental.
To earn a living, Andresa has a hog fattening business. She has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 5,000.
In the future, Andresa hopes to increase her savings.

loans.use: to add capital to her pig-raising business.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is married and has three children. She is 61 years old and lives in Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.
To earn a living, Remedios has a piggery. She has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 10,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 for additional working capital. Remedios has been a member of PMPC for two years.
In the future, Remedios hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to add capital to purchase feed for her pig-raising business.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is widowed and has four children. She is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. Carmelita is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to finance rice production. Carmelita has been a member of PMPC for almost eight years.

loans.use: to pay for plowing her rice field and other production expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies wholesale in addition to dry-goods.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is 64 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has eight children. Eulalia works in the fish industry; she catches and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 for additional capital.
Eulalia has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Eulalia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to add capital to her business of fishing and selling fish.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 55 years old and lives in Lower Rizal, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has five children. Margarita has a store that sells a variety of products, such as soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many other things. She has had this business for 20 years. She has applied for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy additional inventory for her store.
Margarita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Margarita hopes to increase her savings.

loans.use: to build the inventory of her convenience (sari-sari) store.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 41 years old and lives in the province of Bohol in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Divina has been in the rice farming business for several years now. She wants to take out a loan from CEVI to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for labor and rent for the tractor.  

She wants to generate better profits so that she can provide support to her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for labor and rent for the tractor.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is 45 years old and owns a bicycle repair shop in Bombolulu Kisimani Mombasa. He is a married man and together he and his wife support their three children. He has been in this business for the last two years and he has done great. 

He is requesting for his first loan to purchase assorted bicycle accessories for his workshop and use the anticipated revenue to open a new venture. He hopes to have a successful life.

loans.use: To purchase assorted bicycle accessories for his workshop

loans.name: Tranquilino

texts.en:
Tranquilino is 65 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is widowed with two children. 
Tranquilino has a store  that sells variety of products soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many others.  He has had this business for 3 years. He requested a loan of 14,900 pesos to buy additional inventory for sale.

Tranquilino has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Tranquilino hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to add inventory to his sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of medicines.

loans.name: Aundrey Joy

texts.en:
Aundrey Joy is married and has 4 children. She is 36 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Aundrey Joy sells noodles, canned goods and other items to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 3000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP for additional capital to purchase noodles, canned goods and other items.

Aundrey Joy has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, canned goods and other items

loans.name: Raper

texts.en:
Raper is married with 5 children. She is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Raper is a farmer and raises pig to earn a living. She has been doing this for a year. She has requested a loan to purchase feeds. 

Raper has been a member of PMPC for almost six years.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and to pay for the cost of the labor required to work her field.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a hard-working entrepreneur, who has a direct selling, personal and home use products business in the Philippines. Margie has been in this business for seven years. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF, to purchase additional stock to sell.

Margie earns additional income from selling frozen foods.

Margie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional personal and home use products, to resell.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 49 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with ten children.

Zosima works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 for additional capital to purchase more fish to retail.

Zosima has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to retail.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 50 years old and lives in Caluya, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with five children. 

Emelia has an ambulant used shoes vending business and earns approximately PHP 4,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase one bundle of new stock. 

Emelia has been a member of PMPC for seven years.

loans.use: to purchase one bundle of used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Vonnah

texts.en:
Vonnah is married and has two children. She is 22 years old, and she lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Vonnah sells noodles, canned goods and other things, to earn a living. She has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 4,000 doing this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 for additional capital to purchase more inventory for her store.

Vonnah has been a member of PMPC for this year. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, canned goods and other things to resell in her store

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia  is a widow and has four children. Eufemia is 44 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
To earn a living, Eufemia has operated a restaurant for three years. Each month, she earns approximately 25000 PHP. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy raw materials for cooking. Eufemia  has been a member of PMPC for two years.
In the future, Eufemia  hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for cooking in her restaurant.

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Isabelo

texts.en:
Isabelo is 51 years old and lives in Langub, Calamba. He is married with three children. 
Isabelo has a motorcycle transport business and earns approximately PHP 3000 each month. He has requested a loan to make a partial payment on his motorcycle. 
Isabelo has been a member of PMPC for almost two years.

loans.use: to make a partial payment on his motorcycle.

loans.name: Sergio Gonzalo

texts.en: Sergio is asking for a loan to help him finish his university payments and graduate on time. Currently he works forty hours a week in addition to a full school schedule in order to afford his university costs. With the help of a loan, Sergio predicts that he will be able to graduate at the end of this new year. Currently he lives at home and although both his parents had the opportunity to complete college, two of this three siblings are also in college, an expense that far outreaches their family income. Sergio is studying law because he believes in justice and hopes to help others in his community receive the legal support they need. He describes himself as responsible, hard working, and driven to get ahead. Without out the opportunity for a loan Sergio shares that he thinks his best option would be to put school on hold while he works and saves money. With an degree in Law and an entry level job that it could garner, Sergio hopes to earn more than double what he is earning now.

loans.use: To help him finish his university payments and graduate on time

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en: Claudia dreams of becoming a dentist. She chose to be apart of the healthcare industry because she wants a career that can empower her to help people.  Currently Claudia lives at home with her parents, her brother and sister, both of whom are college age as well, and her daughter. In order to afford her tuition and contribute her part to the household income, Claudia works thirty hours a week in addition to attending her university classes.  With a student loan, she plans on purchasing a computer and her school books. With a computer Claudia shares that she would be able to complete her school work far more efficiently. Between her hours at work, her time at school, and caring for her daughter, Claudia has little time to spare. With formal training in dentistry, she expects to find a stable career—one that can help her find financial independence for her and her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase her school books and computer so that she can finish her studies.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en: Marisol is asking for a loan to help her finish her education. She is entering into her final months in her finance degree and the help she has been receiving from her parents is no longer enough. Marisol lives at home with her parents and two older sisters who are both of college as well. She works twenty hours a week as a vendor but her income is not enough to cover all her fees. She has been getting help from her father’s policeman’s salary but as traditionally the graduation semester in Bolivia is the most expensive, Marisol is without enough capital to cover her costs. Without the opportunity for a loan she thinks her graduation timeline would be greatly affected and that she would need to delay all her work until she could save enough. Marisol is passionate about finance and sees is as a field that is expanding in Bolivia and in high demand. With professional training she feels confident that she will be able to find a stable, well paying job after she graduates.

loans.use: To pay for her final semester so she can graduate

loans.name: Christian Bernardo

texts.en: As Christian prepares to graduate, completing his thesis is his final hurdle. Christian works forty hours a week to earn enough income to afford his tuition fees and with his busy schedule he is increasingly concerned about how he is going to complete his thesis without his own computer. With this loan, Christian will be able to purchase a computer and will be able to complete his school responsibilities without having to cut back on his necessary work hours. Christian is passionate about his degree in system analysis because he is interested in all things technology. He hopes that with a degree in this field he will be prepared for a career that will help him get ahead.

loans.use: To pay for a computer so that he can complete his studies.

loans.name: Carina Soledad

texts.en: With a degree in literature Carina dreams of becoming a teacher. Her favorite part about Bolivia is their rich culture and history. By teaching others about literature, Carina hopes to spread the joys of education and Bolivia’s rich culture to others. With a university degree she will have the necessary title to become a teacher and will be able to begin working. Growing up without her father, finances were always tight for her and her mother. Carina took up a job working thirty hours a week while in school but her income is not enough to cover her tuition fees. She has been getting help from her mother’s salary but her position as a merchant can only provide a little extra assistance. In Bolivian universities, a students’ final semester is often associated with an increase of fees. There are fees for the final exam and for a student to submit their final thesis. As Carina enters into her final semester she predicts that she will not be able for afford her graduation fees. Without this opportunity for a Vittana Loan she thinks she would be unable to complete her education.

loans.use: To pay for her exam and thesis fees so she can graduate.

loans.name: Selinah Omenya

texts.en:
Selinah Omenya's school has been doing well. She was able to construct classrooms and also purchased desks, with the money from her previous loan. She plans to use this new loan to expand further, by constructing two more classrooms for her pupils.

With her anticipated profits, Selinah hopes to employ new teachers to support her increasing number of pupils.

She hopes that her school will become a full-fledged academy, in the near future.

loans.use: to construct two more classrooms

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is married and has nine children. She is 57 years old, and she lives in Locsoon, Tudela, Philippines.

Paulina sells a variety of products to earn a living. She has had her business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional products for inventory, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages and detergents. 

Paulina has been a member of PMPC for eight years.  She hopes to financially support immediate family members in the future.

loans.use: to purchase products to resell in her store, such as canned goods, noodles, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Marryjo

texts.en:
Marryjo is married and has one child. She is 34 years old, and she lives in Canicapan, Clarin, Philippines.

Marryjo sells snacks to earn a living and has had this business for four years. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional ingredients to use in making her snacks, such as flour, sugar, and oil.

Marryjo has been a member of PMPC for eight months. She hopes to financially support immediate family members in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients to use in her business of making snacks, such as flour, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie, age 58, prepares and sells snacks to earn a living. She has run her business for the past two years. She lives in Poblacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She and her husband have three children.

She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000, which she will use as additional capital with which to purchase sugar, oil, flour, and other necessary ingredients. 

Tessie is a new member of PMPC this year. In the future, Tessie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, oil, flour and other ingredients

loans.name: Silus

texts.en:
Silus is 32 years old, married, and blessed with two children, aged 10 and 5 years. He runs a retail shop and a small hotel in Narok town. He has done this work for the past four years, earning a monthly income of KES 38,000. 

With a loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, he plans to restock his shop with a variety of consumable products. He will plow back the anticipated profits into his business, for expansion. 

His dream for the future is to be successful in life

loans.use: to restock his retail shop with consumable goods

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is married and has nine children. She is 55 years old, and she lives in San Isidro, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Leonila is a farmer, and grows tomatoes to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 for additional working capital, which she will use to buy fertilizer.

Leonila has been a member of PMPC for this year. Leonila hopes to expand her garden in the future, to plant other crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her tomatoes

location.town: Liloy-San Isidro, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 47 years old and lives in Lusot, Baliangao. He is married and has four children.
 
William has a shop where he sells groceries and beverages. He has had this business for four years. He requested a loan to purchase new stock to sell.

William has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: To purchase 10 boxes of grocery items and beverages to resell in his store.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick, age 47, operates a retail shop where he sells general merchandise. He runs his business so as to meet the daily expenses of his family and to supplement the income that he earns from his transportation business. He supports his wife and five children and wishes to ensure his children's continued education.

His primary business challenges are customers failing to pay on time and having limited capital with which to achieve his plans. Nevertheless, his dream is to expand his business to town.

Patrick is requesting a loan in order to buy general merchandise items such as salt and soap to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise items such as salt and soap to offer for sale

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita, age 51, has operated a general store business for the past four years. Each month, she earns PhP 2,000 doing this type of work. She and her husband have one child and live in Locsoon, Tudela, Philippines.
 
She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 11,000 in order to purchase products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents to offer for sale. Estrellita has been a member of PMPC for four years.  

In the future, Estrellita hope to better support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida, age 52, prepares and sells snacks to earn an income. She earns about PhP 2,600 each month doing this type of work. She and her husband live in Lusot, Baliangao.

Nida has a requested a loan in order to purchase raw ingredients with which to prepare her snacks.

Nida has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for the snacks she prepares and sells

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: El Sr. Rodrigo  tiene 22 años,  el se dedica a la construcción de puertas tiene su carpintería que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Germán Busch de la ciudad de el Alto  se dedica a esta actividad desde hace ya 3 años esta actividad lo aprendió de su padre quien también era carpintero,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Rodrigo  utilizara  este préstamo  para  la compra de madera para la construcción de puertas , su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de este material de trabajo, ya que sin esto no podría realizar puertas,  El Sr. Rodrigo  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite mantenerse, por este motivo se siente feliz ya agradecido a la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Rodrigo, 22, makes a living building doors.  His carpentry shop is located in the Germán Busch area of the city of El Alto.  He has worked in this job for three years.  He learned it from his father, who also was a carpenter.

This is Rodrigo's first loan sequence with the institution.  He'll use this loan to buy wood to make doors.  He's requesting the loan because he doesn't have the capital to buy these work, materials, and without them he wouldn't be able to make doors.

Rodrigo faces challenges in his business, such as getting out of poverty.  He's going to use the profits to improve his quality of life, because this is his only activity that allows him to support himself.  This is why he's happy and grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: to buy wood to make doors

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 35 years old, married to Ruth, and blessed with two children. He designs and makes clothing in the Kasarani area. He has been in this business for the past 10 years and earns an income of KES 70,000 per month.

He has a good credit history with KADET LTD. Now, he is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD, in the amount of KES 80,000. He plans to use the loan to buy new machines and add to his stock of materials for making clothes. He will use the anticipated profit to re-invest in this business.

He hopes to expand, and to invest in new business opportunities.

loans.use: To expand his business, by purchasing new machines and materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena, age 36, operates an auto repair shop. She earns approximately PhP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. She lives with her husband and their one child in Panalsalan Tangub City.
 
Lorena has a requested a loan in order to buy a new machine for her auto repair business.  She has been a member of PMPC for the past year. 

In the future, Lorena hopes to expand her auto repair shop.

loans.use: to buy a new machine for her auto repair business

loans.name: Felipe Santiago

texts.es: El señor Felipe Habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa, ella le apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que es comerciante y tiene sus propios ingresos, el es un hombre muy trabajador ya que tiene su propio negocio, el es ebanista de profesion y gracias a los trabajos que le encargan ha sacado adelante a su familia, con este nuevo credito comprar Materiales como Madera, pegamento, Lijas etc. con esto sus ganancias aumentaran y podra realizar mejoras en su casa de  habitacion que es su mayor prioridad, Agradece el apoyo brindado por parte de Afodenic y Fondos Kiva.
texts.en: Felipe lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with his wife.  She’s a merchant and owns her own income and helps with household expenses.  He’s a very hardworking man who has his own business.  He’s a cabinetmaker by profession and thanks to the work he’s asked to do he’s moved his family forward.  He will use this new loan to buy supplies like lumber, glue, sandpaper, etc.  With this, his profits will increase and he will be able to do some home improvements which are his greatest priority.  He is grateful for the support provided by Afodenic and Kiva funds.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: El Sr. Tomas   tiene 29 años,  se dedica  a la construcción y remodelación de viviendas, el es albañil contratista, el vive en la localidad de El Torno,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Tomas   va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta ya que esto le permitirá realizar su trabajo de manera eficiente ya que tiene contratos que cumplir, y esto le permitirá movilizarse de manera rápida a sus obras ya que son distancias largas que tiene que recorrer,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en trabajo, el  Sr. Tomas   va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar Herramientas para su trabajo ya que las que tiene se le están gastando y necesita renovar para realizar un mejor trabajo, El Sr. Tomas   es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada  en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es su única  actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en: Tomas, 29, works in construction and home remodeling.  He’s a building contractor.  He lives in El Torno.  This loan is his first sequence in the institution and Tomas will use the loan to buy a motorcycle so he can do his work more efficiently since he has contracts to fulfill and this will allow him to get to his various construction sites more quickly.  His reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving at work.  Tomas will use profits to buy work tools because the ones he has are wearing down and he needs to replace them in order to do better work.  Tomas is a very hardworking person who feels happy for the opportunity being provided by granting the loan since this is the only activity he has to support himself with.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Lenin Gustavo

texts.es: El señor Lenin, hombre trabajador y luchador, para el su mayor prioridad es su familia y su hogar, el labora para una empresa privada, y sus mayor sueño en la vida es tener mejores condiciones en su casa de Habitacion, con este nuevo financiamiento comprara materiales de construcion como Cemento, Arena, Piedrin, Hierro etc. Agradece el apoyo que le han brindado tanto Afodenic como Fondo Kiva.
texts.en: Lenin is a hardworking, driven man; his greatest priority is his family and his home.  He works for a private firm and his greatest dream in life is to have better living conditions.  He will use this new loan to buy building materials like cement, sand, gravel, iron rods, etc.  He’s thankful for the support Afodenic and Kiva have provided him.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 46 years old and lives in Lorenzo Tan, Tangub City. She is married and has two children.
 
Brenda has a shop that sells basic needs products. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan to have additional capital for her business, so that she can buy more groceries for inventory.

Brenda has been a member of PMPC for two months. She hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to resell in her store.

location.town: Tangub-Lorenzo Tan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Beofnato

texts.en:
Beofnato, age 37, sells groceries and beverages to earn a living. He has operated this business for 10 years. Each month, he earns PhP 4500 doing this type of work. He lives with his wife and their one child in Lusot, Baliangao.

Beofnato has requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 in order to purchase 10 boxes of groceries and 10 cases of beverages for his store.

Beofnato has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase 10 boxes of groceries and 10 cases of beverages for his store

loans.name: Juana Del Rosario

texts.es: Doña Juana es una mujer trabajadora, junto a su esposo han sacado a sus hijos adelante, su sueño es tener una casa digna donde goce de buenas condiciones, ella cultiva la tierra desde muy joven y actualmente necesita darle mantenimiento a su siembro de Citricos como Naranja y Mandarinas ya que con el mal clima y las Plagas tene perder la cosecha, Gracias al Apoyo de Afodenic y Fondos Kiva comprara insumos y fertilizantes necesario para un optimo  Mantenimiento.
texts.en: Juana’s a hardworking woman who has raised her children with her husband.  Her dream is to have a proper house that’s in good condition.  She’s worked in the fields since she was very young and needs to provide crop maintenance to her citrus, orange and mandarin, crops because she fears that the bad weather and crop infestations will cause her to lose her harvest.  Thanks to support from Afodenic and Kiva she will buy the supplies and fertilizer needed for optimum care.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Ingrid Genissell

texts.es: La señora Ingrid, habita en el municipio de Masaya en la comunidad Las Conchitas junto a su esposo y su hijo, ella labora para una empresa privada al igual que su esposo, entre los dos asumen los gastos del hogar en la actualidad ellos conviven en la casa de la Mama de Doña  Ingrid y necesitan acondicionar un cuarto para poder tener mejores condiciones, con este credito que se les ha otorgado compraran Marteriales como Bloques, Cemento, Arena, Hierro. Agradecen el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en: Ingrid lives in the municipality of Masaya in the Las Conchitas community with her husband and son.  She works for a private firm as does her husband.  The two of them assume household expenses.   They currently share Ingrid’s mother’s house and need to furnish a room to have better conditions.  With this granted loan they will buy supplies like concrete blocks, cement, sand and iron rods.  They are thankful for the support Afodenic and Kiva has given her.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Elba

texts.en:
Elba, age 55, sells second-hand clothing to earn a living. She has operated this business for three years. Each month, she earns PhP 15,000 doing this type of work. She and her husband have seven children and live in Poblacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.
 
Elba has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000, which she will use as additional capital for buying more second-hand clothing to offer for sale. She is a new member of PMPC this year. 

In the future, Elba hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothing to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers (N.P.K. and irea) for farming and pay the cost of labour.

loans.name: Leyla

texts.es:
Leyla, de 41 años, es una mujer emprendedora, pujante y soñadora, le gusta cumplir con lo que se propone, trabaja mucho pues desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida y buena educación a los 5 hijos que tiene junto a Félix. Vive en su casa propia que construyó junto a su conviviente desde hace 18 años. El trabajo de Leyla consiste en la venta de abarrotes y artículos de primera necesidad. Tiene un pequeño puesto en una esquina muy concurrida del mercado principal de la ciudad en donde a diario vende muchos productos y tiene buenas ganancias, La paciencia es una de sus principales virtudes y eso le ha permitido enfrentar la tremenda competencia desde que se inició en este trabajo. Asumió retos para su progreso y hoy por hoy impulsada por sus deseos de superación realiza sus ventas atendiendo siempre con alegría y gratitud. Vende productos de limpieza y abarrotes variados como arroz, azúcar, aceite entre otros, compra al por mayor en las tiendas comerciales de manera semanal. Lleva en este trabajo desde hace 6 años, ha trabajado sola siempre pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su hermana.
Su negocio le apasiona pues le gusta estar en contacto con las personas ya que a diario vive siempre nuevas experiencias, además su labor le permite generar los ingresos que necesita su familia para solventar los gastos básicos que requieren como alimentación y el pago de los servicios del hogar. Su gran deseo es tener su propio centro comercial en el que pueda distribuir al por mayor los productos que ahora ofrece. Este es el préstamo número 16 con la institución MFP, siempre fue muy buena socia en su banco comunal en donde la quieren mucho por ser muy responsable y solidaria, agradece que le brinden el préstamo que será un respaldo para ella y seguir implementando su negocio, está convencida que seguirá siendo una socia muy puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo como todos los prestamos que tuvo hasta ahora.
Con el monto solicitado 3500 soles, comprará arroz en sacos, huevos, aceites, detergentes, jabones, azúcar, fideos entre otros productos para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Leyla, 41, is an enterprising, determined woman with dreams; she likes to accomplish what she proposes.  She works hard because she wants to provide a better quality of life and a good education for the five children she has with Félix.  She lives in her own house that she built alongside her spouse 18 years ago.  

Leyla’s work consists in selling groceries and basic staple items.  She has a small stand on a very busy corner in the city’s main market where she sells many products daily and earns good profits.  Patience is one of her main virtues and this has allowed her to face competition since she started in business.  She took on growth challenges and today, motivated by her wish to become better, she sells always cheerfully and gratefully.  She sells cleaning supplies and varied grocery items like rice, sugar and oil, among others.  She buys at wholesale from commercial stores weekly.  She’s been in business six years and has always worked alone although her sister does help her occasionally.

She’s passionate about her business because she likes to be in contact with people because she experiences new things every day.  Also, her work makes it possible for her to earn income her family needs to cover basic expenses like food and utilities.  Her great desire is to have her own shopping center where she can sell the things she currently stocks at wholesale.

This is MFP loan #16.  She’s always been a very good member of her communal bank where she’s very well liked for being very responsible and supportive.  She is grateful that she’s being granted a loan because it will back her up so she can stay in business.  She’s convinced that she will continue to be a very punctual member and will make her installment payments on time like she’s done with all the loans she’s had to date.  She will use the requested 3,500 soles to buy sacks of rice, eggs, oil, detergent, soap, sugar and noodles among other products to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina has owned and operated a motorcycle transport business for more than two years now. Her husband drives the motorcycle and uses it to transport passengers from one place to another. They have eight children and live in Ubay, Bohol.
 
Gina is requesting a loan in order to buy spare parts for the motorcycle, such as nuts and bolts, as well as motorcycle fuel. With these purchases, she and her husband will be able to maintain the good working condition of the motorcycle.
 
In the future, Gina dreams of expanding their business as well as exploring other ventures with which to augment their income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the motorcycle, such as nuts and bolts, as well as motorcycle fuel

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is involved in a small family agricultural business in the village of Tegh in the Syunik region. She lives with her husband and mother. They keep livestock, currently three cows and two oxen. Stella milks the cows and produces cheese, which she sells at the local market for a stable monthly income.
 
As agriculture is the only source of income for this family, Stella would like to expand the venture. She has requested this loan in order to purchase three cows. This will enable her to obtain more milk and make more cheese to offer for sale.

The loan is very important for Stella and her family because it will improve their living conditions and ensure them a better future.

loans.use: to buy three cows

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analisa, age 45, runs a general store business where she sells such items as noodles and canned goods to earn a living. She has operated this business for 25 years. Each month, she earns PhP 2,600 doing this type of work. She and her husband have eight children and live in Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.
 
Analisa has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 14,900, which she will use as additional capital in order to purchase noodles, canned goods and other general merchandise to sell in her store. She has been a member of PMPC for three years. 

In the future, Analisa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, canned goods and other general merchandise to sell in her store

location.town: Liloy-Villa C. Sudiacal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Nort

loans.name: Odalis

texts.es:
Odalis, de 33 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy responsable, es conviviente con su pareja Richard de 41 años y con quien tiene dos menores hijos Yeni de 14 y Richard de 8 años de edad respectivamente, ella vive a lado de su familia en una casa propia en donde a diario brinda lo mejor a su familia ya que desea darles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Odalis consiste en la compra y venta de vehículos, a diario abre su negocio que esta ubicado en su casa en una esquina muy concurrida por el tránsito vehicular y todo tipo de público, ahí espera la llegada de sus clientes o sale a buscarlos como es muy común en ella ya que no le gusta estar sin realizar ninguna actividad, al momento de realizar la transacción de los vehículos siempre está muy al pendiente de brindar todos los documentos en regla y que los vehículos estén en óptimas condiciones y en buen funcionamiento ya que no quiere tener problemas mas adelante con sus compradores, lleva realizando este negocio por 6 años y lo hace a lado de su conviviente quien se encarga de refaccionar los vehículos que ponen luego a la venta.
Le gusta lo que hace ya que le permite tener buenos ingresos, a veces saca un porcentaje alto de las venta pero algunas veces solo gana para sobrellevar los gastos del día, pero siempre está con el ánimo elevado con una sonrisa para todos los que se acercan a preguntar por el precio de alguno de los vehículos que ofrece, espera poder seguir trabajando y crecer poco a poco y más adelante poner una tienda de venta de vehículos nuevos. Este es el crédito numero 7 con la institución MFP, por tanto agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito, para continuar con sus objetivos y crecimiento programado, además esta muy decidida a cumplir una vez más con sus pagos de manera puntual como lo hizo hasta ahora en sus créditos anteriores, le agrada mucho pertenecer al grupo que integra ya que reconoce que todos los miembros que participan en él son personas muy puntuales y responsables.
Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará 2 vehículos para refaccionarlos y ponerlos a la venta a precios cómodos y continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Odalis, 33, is an enterprising, very responsible woman.  She lives with her spouse, Richard, 41, with whom she has two minor children, Yeni, 14, and Richard, 8.  She lives with her family in a house of her own where she daily offers the best to her family since she wants to give them a better quality of life.

Odalis’ work consists in buying and selling vehicles.  She opens her business that’s home-based every day.  It’s located on a corner with much vehicular traffic and people of all sorts.  She waits for her customers to arrive there or she goes out seeking them out which is quite usual for her to do because she doesn’t like to sit idly by with no activity.  At the moment of carrying out a transaction she’s very careful to have all documents in order and that the vehicles are in optimum condition and operating well in order not to have any future problems with her buyers.  She’s been in this business six years and does it alongside her spouse who is in charge of repairing all the vehicles they put up for sale.

She likes what she does because it allows her to earn good income.  Sometimes she earns a high profit margin and sometimes only enough to cover daily expenses but she’s always highly motivated and has a smile for everyone who approaches to ask the price of any of the vehicles she sells.  She hopes to be able to continue working and to gradually grow and later on open a new vehicle store.

This is MFP loan #7 and she thanks all those who make the loan possible so she can continue towards her objectives and programmed growth.  She’s also quite determined once again to make her payments punctually like she’s done up to now in all her previous loans.  She very much enjoys being part of her group because she realizes that all the embers who participate in it are very punctual, responsible people.  She will use the requested 3,000 soles to buy two vehicles to repair and put up for sale at affordable prices and to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy two vehicles to repair and put into service.

loans.name: Eugenia Lisseth

texts.es:
Eugenia  vive en las orquídeas tiene 23 años, es soltera. Ella tomo la decisión de buscar trabajo para terminar sus estudios, como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar .Ella decidio  juntar dinero para dar apertura  a su negocio de venta  en general.

En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  una clientela  .Eugenia trabaja en su negocio  diariamente, ella  visita a sus clientes para obtener sus pedidos .Con el préstamo comprara  cosméticos, perfumes, cremas , varios etc. Su meta es poder  terminar su carrera universitaria
texts.en:
Eugenia is 23 years old, single, and lives in Las Orquídeas. She decided to look for work so that she could finish her studies, but nobody was offering any job opportunities. Eugenia elected to gather her money together so that she could open her own retail business.

At the moment, her business is growing gradually and now she has a customer base. Eugenia works every day at her business, visiting with her customers in an effort to obtain orders. With this loan, she will buy cosmetics, perfumes, crèmes, and various other items.

Her goal is to finish her university degree.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes, crèmes, and various other items.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, age 67 and widowed, runs a general store business to earn a living. She has operated her business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PhP 3,000 doing this type of work. She and her husband have five children and live in Locsoon, Tudela, Philippines.
 
Erlinda has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 14,900 to purchase additional products to sell in her store, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents. Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for eight years.  

In the future, Erlinda hope to better financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell in her store, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 47 years old and lives in Guba, Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with three children. She requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for her farm .Marilyn has been a member of PMPC for three years. Marilyn hopes that in the future, they can improve their living with the help of our cooperative.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is married, with two children. He is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. Raul is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. He has been doing this for 15 years. 

Raul has requested a loan to finance his rice production. He has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for three years.

loans.use: to finance his rice production.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia, de 42 años, es una madre soltera, que con esfuerzo, coraje y sacrificio pudo sacar adelante a sus tres hijos que ahora tienen 23, 20 y 16 años y viven juntos en su casa propia que pudo comprar con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. El trabajo de Eulalia consiste en la venta de comida, por las mañana ella venderá desayunos y al medio día almuerzos y por las noches vende asados y comida variadas, ella realiza este trabajo sola  y espera le vaya bien ya que es nueva en esta actividad, tiene un espacio acondicionado en su casa para poder tener todas las comodidades para su trabajo, las ganas no le faltan de poder salir adelante y crecer con su trabajo.
A ella le gusta mucho cocinar y estar en contacto con la gente, esto le sirve como un factor determinante para que gane a sus clientes cada día, espera poder trabajar bien y generar muchas ganancias para solventar los gastos en su hogar, en le futuro quiere tener su restaurante formal y  poder hacer empresa en su distrito. Este será su  préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, por ello solicita de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. espera que los demás integrantes del grupo le ayuden a integrarse y a llevar el ritmo de trabajo que tienen y no fallarles.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles ella comprará materiales para terminar sus sillas, ingredientes e insumos para iniciar con su venta.
texts.en:
Eulalia, 42, is a single mother who with much effort, valor and sacrifice was able to raise her three children who are now 23, 20 and 16 years of age.  They live together in her own house that she was able to buy thanks to much effort and sacrifice.  

Eulalia’s work consists in selling food.  She sells breakfasts in the morning, lunches at midday and grilled meats and various dishes at night.  She does this work alone and hopes to do well since it’s a new activity.  She has space at home set aside for this that she hopes to make comfortable for her work.  She does not lack for desire to be able to get ahead and to grow with her work.

She enjoys cooking and being in contact with people very much.  This is a determining factor for her to win over customers every day.  She hopes to be able to work well and earn much profit to cover household expenses.  In future, she’d like to have a real restaurant and be able to be a businesswoman in her district.  

This will be MFP loan #2 and she’s hoping for your collaboration so she can make her plans reality.  She hopes the other group members will help her become integrated into the group and keep up with their work rhythm so she won’t disappoint them.  She will use the requested 1,000 soles to buy materials to finish her chairs and ingredients and supplies to start with her sales.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish her chairs and ingredients and supplies to start selling..

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en: Jerry is single with no children. Jerry is 34 years old and lives in Pisaan Bonifacio. Jerry is a farmer and grows coconuts to earn a living. He has been doing this for 16 years. He has requested a loan to buy fertilizer. Jerry has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Jerry hopes to expand his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 54 years old, married and blessed with three children that he supports. He has been running a butcher shop in Narok town for the last four years with a monthly income of KES. 20,000. 

He has applied for a loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD to purchase more animals for slaughter.


The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into his business for expansion. His future dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to buy livestock to slaughter

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda is married, with three children. She is 35 years old and lives in Lorenzo Tan, Tangub City. Cresilda sells bread to earn a living and has had this business for three years. 

Cresilda has requested a loan to add for her capital. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for two years. In the future, Cresilda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to add to her business capital.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 61 years old and married with four children. Juvy works very hard to provide for them.

Juvy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Juvy has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, bread, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Juvy would like to save enough to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Siyavush

texts.en: Siyavush is 47, married and the father of three children in his care. Siyavush provides a locksmith service and has his own mechanical workshop.  He is a master of his job, always busy and has lots of customers who bring their vehicles to be repaired. Siyavush has no help in the workshop to do different jobs. He needs a loan in order to buy new equipment, which will help him to accommodate the needs, to finish orders in time and maintain the clients.

loans.use: To buy new equipment for vehicle repairs.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is married, with one child. He is 63 years old and lives in Liloy-Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. Roberto sells noodles, canned goods, and other items to earn a living and has had this business for seven years. Each month, he earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. 

Roberto has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 for additional capital for his business. He has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for two years. In the future, Roberto hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, canned goods, and other items for his business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is widowed and has four children. Juana is 59 years old, and she lives in Conat, Aloran, Misamis-Occidental, Philippines.

Juana earns a living as a farmer. She has been doing this for seven years. She has requested a loan to buy land for farming. 

Juana has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Juana hopes to own land.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Yovan

texts.en: Yovan is a 70-year-old, married man, living in Masindi, Uganda. For sixteen years now, he has been operating a hardware shop and he started the business after realizing that farming alone could not help him meet his family's needs. His dreams are to build a permanent residential house, since he lives in a semi-permanent dwelling, and to expand his hardware shop to new markets. Yovan intends to use the loan to buy construction materials, such as cement and sand, for his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement and sand, for his house.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan Bautista de 68 años de edad, casado con dos hijos, de 23,13 años, los cuales están bajo su responsabilidad están estudiado. Él es originario de la ciudad de Chinandega, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy trabajador, responsable. Desde muy joven ha tenido que trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, por falta de recursos económico, lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitario. Por tanto lucha día a día para que sus hijos tengan un futuro mejor
Él se desempeña brindando servicio de reparación de calzado en un tramo de unos de los mercado de la localidad. Actividad que la desempeña como mucho gusto ya que ha sido su forma de vida y la de su familia. El crédito lo está solicitando para terminar de realizar mejoras a su casa de habitación como es construir un cuarto y  poner el piso a la sala. Los créditos anteriores han sido para mejoras de la casa, gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado los inversionistas kiva es que tiene un techo digno donde vivir y brindarle la seguridad a su familia. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar material de construcción como: zinc, arena, cerámica, madera, perlines, clavos, alfajillas, pintura.
texts.en:
Juan Bautista, 68, is married with two children who re 23, and 13 years of age and who are in his care and attending school.  He’s from the city of Chinandega, a place located in the west of the country.  He’s noted for being a very hardworking, responsible man.  He’s had to work since he was very young to help with household expenses.  Because of the lack of economic resources, he was unable to attend university so he must strive daily so his children can have a better future.

He works providing shoe repair services in a stand in one of the local markets, an activity he does gladly because it’s his and his family’s way of life.  The loan he’s requesting is to finish doing some home improvements like building a room and installing flooring in the living room.  His previous loans have been used for home improvement and thanks to the help Kiva lenders have given him he has a proper home to live in and provide security for his family.  The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and to buy building supplies like metal sheeting, sand, tile, lumber, roofing purlins, nails, window frames and paint.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Bernarda Lila

texts.es: La señora Bernarda habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo y familia, labora para una empresa privada su mayor sueño es terminar de construir su casa y Gracias al apoyo de Afodenic atravez de Fondos Kiva ella esta cumpliendo su sueño, con este nuevo financiamiento comprara  Materiales para realizar algunas construciones que su casa requiere, comprara: cemento, ceramica.
texts.en: Bernarda lives in Ticuantepe with her husband and family.  She works for a private firm and her greatest wish is to finish building her house.  Thanks to support from Afodenic via Kiva funds she’s reaching this dream.  She will use this new loan to buy building materials to do some building her house needs.  She will buy cement and tile.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is married, with one child. She is 49 years old and lives in Talic, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. Florita sells fruits to earn a living and has had this business for eight years. 

Florita has requested a loan to buy additional fruits for her business. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for one year. In the future, Florita hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits for her business.

loans.name: Sharry

texts.en:
Sharry, 31, has three children. She lives in Ibabao, Aloran, Misamis-Occidental, Philippines.

Sharry engages in a "buy-and-sell' business to earn a living. She has been doing this work for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000  for additional capital, so she can buy more products for customers of her buy-and-sell business.

Sharry has been a member of PMPC for eight years.  She hopes to have more savings for her children, in the future.

loans.use: to buy more products for clients of her buy-and-sell business.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, de 54 años, es un hombre muy bueno y responsable, es separado de la madre de sus hijo  con quien tiene tres hijos que ya son mayores e independientes, el vive en el fundo de su jefe ya que trabaja cuidando un fundo el cual el también utiliza para sus sembríos y como granja de sus animales.
El trabajo de Carlos consiste en la siembra y cosecha de cítricos, y algunos productos regionales como yuca, plátano, ají charapita y otros, además cría animales como gallinas, patos, pollo, vacas, etc. Este trabajo lo realiza en la chacra de su patrón ya que el es empleado y a cambio el puede utilizar la tierra del fundo para sembrar sus productos además de criar en el sus animales. Realiza su trabaja solo y cuando es necesario con algunos peones para poder ayudarlo en la siembra.
Le gusta mucho su trabajo por que está siempre en la naturaleza, además que tiene tiempo libre para muchas actividades, espera mantenerse con su producción y poder comprar mas adelante su propio fundo en donde pueda el mismo trabajar con sus sembríos y sus animales. Este será su préstamo número 10 con la institución  MFP, siempre fue muy buen socio en su banco comunal en donde lo quieren mucho por que es muy responsable y solidario, espera que le puedan brindar el préstamo que será un respaldo para él y seguir aumentando sus materiales de trabajo, está convencido que seguirá siendo un socio muy puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo como todos los prestamos que tuvo hasta ahora. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará granos y algunos palos de yuca, además pagara a algunas personas para que le ayuden en el sembrío que es un poco trabajoso.
texts.en:
Carlos, 54, is a good, responsible man; he’s separated from the mother of his children.  He has three children who are all independent adults now.  He lives on his boss’s property and works caring for his crops.  He also uses this land for his own crops and to keep his animals.

Carlos’ work consists in growing citrus fruit and some regional products like manioc, bananas, ‘charapita’ chili peppers, and others.  He also raises animals like chickens, ducks, cows, etc.  He does this work on his boss’s land since he’s his employee and in return is allowed to use the estate’s land to plant his own crops and to raise his animals.  He does his work alone and only when necessary hires some day laborers to help him with the planting.
