He enjoys his work very much because he’s always out in nature and also has free time for many other activities.  He hopes to keep producing and to be able to later on buy his own agricultural estate where he can work growing his crops and raise his animals.

This is his 10th MFP loan.  He’s always been a good member of his communal bank where he’s very well-liked because he’s very responsible and supportive.  He hopes they will be able to provide him this loan because it will be good back-up for him to continue increasing his work supplies.  He’s convinced that he’ll continue to be a very punctual member and will pay all his installments on time like he’s done with all the previous loans he’s had.  He will use the requested 2,500 soles to buy grain and some manioc plants and he will also pay for some laborers to help him with the planting which is a bit hard work.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and hire day laborers to help with the heavy tasks.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 47 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom attend school.  She has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for four years. 

Vilma is requesting a loan from NWTF for 18,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.  In the future, Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mirson

texts.es:
Mirson, de 46 años, es padre soltero tiene un hijo quien es mayor de edad y tiene su propia familia, vive solo en su casa propia en donde algunas veces llegan sus hermanas y su hijo a visitarlo o a pasar un fin de semana.

El trabajo de Mirson consiste en la siembra de productos regionales como yuca, plátano,  tomate, culantro, entre otros. Además tiene algunas cabezas de ganado, cada día se levanta muy temprano para realizar sus labores como cultivar, fumigar, extraer leche fresca de sus ganados, todas estas actividades los realiza en su chacra que esta ubicado a pocos kilómetros de su casa. Lleva en este trabajo más de 15 años, trabaja solo pues su hijo es independiente y tiene otras tierras, en algunas ocasiones contrata algunos peones para ayudarlo solo en época de siembra y cosecha.
Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que está siempre al aire libre y dispone de su tiempo como a el mejor le parece, además dice que no hay nada mejor que ser independiente, espera poder mantener su negocio ya que de esto vive y espera poder seguir haciéndolo por varios años más. Este  será su crédito  número 18 con la institución MFP, por ello solicita de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Le va muy bien en el grupo, es un socio fundador y siempre resulto ser buen pagador de sus cuotas, agradece mucho la oportunidad que le dieron para crecer con su trabajo y espera poder seguir haciéndolo por mucho más tiempo.
Con el monto solicitado 2500 comprará productos regionales de otras chacras para venderlas al por mayor en la ciudad, además de invertir en algunos granos y abonos para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Mirson is a 46-year-old single father of one older son who has his own family. He lives alone in his own house where his sisters and son sometimes come to visit him or spend a weekend. 

Mirson's work consists in the planting of regional crops such as yucca, plantain, tomatoes, cilantro, and more. He also has a few heads of cattle. Every day he gets up very early to do his work such as cultivating his crops, fumigating pests, and extracting fresh milk from his cattle. All of these activities take place on his small farm, located a few kilometres from his house. Mirson has spent more than 15 years doing this work so that his child could be independent. He has a few other plots of land, and sometimes he contracts workers to help him but only during planting and harvest. 

He really likes his work because it is always outside and he can use his time in the way he thinks is best. What's more he says that there is nothing better than being independent. He hopes that he can maintain his business and keep working on it a few years more. This will be his 18th loan with MFP, and he is asking for your collaboration so he can realize his plans. 

It's going very well with the group. Mirson is a founding member and always pays his quotas on time. He is grateful for the opportunity MFP has given him to grow with his work and hopes he can continue doing it for a long time. With the requested amount, 2500 soles, he will buy regional products from other small farms to sell wholesale in the city, and invest in some grains and fertilizers for his fields.

loans.use: to buy regional products from other small farms and sell them wholesale in the city, and to invest in some grains and fertilizers for his own fields

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés, de 53 años, es una mujer alegre, amable y muy emprendedora, es madre de siete hijos de los cuales solo dos de 17 y 11 años viven con ella ahora ya que los demás son mayores e independientes, vive con sus dos hijos y su pareja Pedro en su casa propia, ellos a diario trabajan mucho para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
El trabajo de Inés comienza cuando sale muy temprano a la chacra, se va a cultivar, regar y preparar la tierra para sus sembríos, además ella se dedica a la miel de abeja y sombrío de camu-camu, tiene chacra propia y en el viene trabajando ya por  más de 23 años aproximadamente, ella aprendió a hacer este trabajo desde muy joven ya que heredo esto de sus padres, ahora ella esta enseñando a sus dos menores hijos quienes después de volver del colegio se van a ayudarla y así aprenden del negocio familiar.
Le gusta su trabajo ya que tiene tiempo y puede compartirlo con sus hijos, tiene buenas ventas ya que los productos que le dan sus tierras son muy buenos, ella envía sus productos a la ciudad de Lima donde su hijo se encarga de venderlos, espera poder mantenerse así y más adelante poder empezar con otro tipo de sombríos también.
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará mas semillas para sembrar, pagara a algunos trabajadores para que le ayuden a sembrar pimiento y iniciar una nueva actividad.
texts.en:
Inés, 53, is a cheerful, kind, very enterprising woman.  She’s the mother of seven children of which only her 17-year-old and 11-year-old still live with her; all the others are independent adults now.  She lives with her two children and with her husband, Pedro, in her own house.  They work hard every day to provide their family with better quality of life.

Inés’ work starts when she heads to her fields very early to till, water and prepare the soil for her plants.  She also produces honey and camu-camu fruit.  She has her own field and has been working it for approximately 23 years.  She learned how to do this work when still very young having inherited it from her parents.  Now, she’s teaching her two youngest children who help her when they get out of school thus learning the family business.

She likes her work because she has time to spend with her children.  Her sales are good because her land produces very good products.  She sends them to the city of Lima where her son is in charge of selling them.  She hopes to remain like this and later on start with different types of plants.  She will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy more seeds to plant and to pay a few laborers that will help her plant peppers and start a new activity.

loans.use: to buy more seeds to plant and to pay for day laborers to help her.

loans.name: Nicky

texts.es:
Nicky, de 34 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso con muchas ganas de progresar, es conviviente con Malti quien es madre de sus hijos. Vive en compañía de su conviviente, sus hijos de 14 y 08 años de edad, habitando cómodamente en su propia casa.

La actividad que realiza Nicky es el cultivo de de yucas y plátanos  para la venta en los mercados de la localidad y para su consumo personal,  además de tener sombríos de palma aceitera contando para eso con un terreno de 20 hectáreas  que lo adquirió hace 10 años, tiempo que viene ejerciendo este oficio y  contando con la ayuda de su conviviente en las cosechas con  quien  comparte las ganancias.
Le gusta su negocio pues lo conoce muy bien ya que lleva muchos años dedicándose a ese oficio, y dicha experiencia la está pasando a sus hijos, además de las ganancias que le deja con la cual a sabido mantener a su familiar y procuro que no les falte lo necesario. Por lo contrario lo que no le gusta es que la lejanía de su ubicación ha demorado en llevar los servicios básicos como la luz eléctrica, pero con los nuevos programas eso se está logrando mejorar este lugar, ahora tiene los deseos de ampliar su negocio y dejara a sus hijos con algo seguro para su futuro. Este será el crédito  número 06 con la institución MFP. Por ello solicita de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus. Además de estar bien con banco comunal pues conoce a la mayoría de sus integrantes y los considera buenas personas.
Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de abono para la producción de palma. También pagará al personal para la cosecha de sus productos.
texts.en:
Nicky, 34, is a hardworking, dedicated man who very much wants to make progress.  He lives with Malti who is the mother of their children.  He lives with his spouse and children who are 14 and 8 years old comfortably in his own house.

Nicky’s activity is growing manioc and bananas to sell in local markets and for personal consumption.  He also grows palm trees for their oil and to do so has 20 hectares of land he acquired ten years ago which is the length of time he’s been in this occupation; his spouse helps him with the harvests and he shares profits with her.

He likes his business because he knows it well since he’s been doing it for many years and he’s passing the experience down to his children.  Also, he’s learned how to manage the profits earned to support his family and see that they have everything they need.  On the other hand, what he dislikes is the distance of his location for basic utilities like electricity have been slow in coming but with the new programs improvement is taking place in his location.  

He now wants to expand the business to leave something sure for his children’s future.  This will be MFP loan #6 and he’s asking for your collaboration to make his plans reality.  He feels good in his communal bank because he knows most of the members and considers them to be good people.  He will use the requested 2,000 new soles to buy manure for the palm trees and he will also pay for staff to help with the harvest.

loans.use: to buy manure and to hire laborers.

loans.name: Sarkhan

texts.en:
Sarkhan is 28 years old, married, and one child. He lives in Marneuli District with his wife, child, parents, and retired grandmothers. Sarkhan earns a living through his agricultural business. The family has a vineyard and a plot of land where alfalfa is grown. The harvested products are sold in the village. He also runs a small dairy farm with four calves and two milk cows, whose milk is used in dairy products. The family sells the dairy locally.  

Sarkhan is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase a mini-bus to transport the passengers between his village and Baku. His loan request was approved in the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup loans with soft conditions to the country rural poor, who do not have access to loans and who are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the loan, Sarkhan will be able to start a new business providing transportation services to the Marneuli District population. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus for providing transportation services.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married and has five children. She is 44 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philipines.

Agnes is engaged in a buy-and-sell business to earn a living. She has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this work.  She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 for additional capital for her buy-and-sell business.

Agnes hopes to have more savings in the future.

loans.use: to buy more products for customers of her buy-and-sell business.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is married and has four children. He is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Joel is a farmer, who grows rice to earn a living. He has been doing this for five years. He has requested a loan to pay for the necessary expenses for preparing the rice field, including fertilizer.
 
Joel has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: To prepare the field and buy fertilizer, for rice production.

loans.name: Reconalla

texts.en:
Reconalla, 44, is married with three children. For the past ten years she has sold noodles, canned goods and other related items to earn a living. Each month she earns approximately 5,000 PHP doing so.

Reconalla has been a member of PMPC for two years. She is applying for a 8,500 loan for additional capital for her shop. She hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, canned goods and other related items.

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Charina

texts.en:
Charina, 38, is married with five children. She has a restaurant and earns approximately 10,000 each month from it.

Charina has been a member of PMPC for two years. She is applying for a 40,000 PHP loan to buy more ingredients for the food she serves. She is working on expanding her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for the food she serves.

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Mwamba Group

texts.fr: La cliente Luanda est entrepreneur, conseillère du groupe d’affaire Mwamba, âgée de 44 ans, mariée, mère de 12 enfants qui étudient tous. Son mari est un enseignant. La cliente vendeuse d’habillement. Elle s’installe au marché central de Virunga. Elle démarra son activité avec un fonds propre reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’acheter 20 pièces. En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise et scolariser ses enfants. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
Luanda is an entrepreneur and member of the Mwamba business group. She is 44 years old, married, and the mother of 12 children who are all in school. Her husband is a teacher, and Luanda is a clothing saleswoman. Her business is located at the Central Market of Virunga.

Luanda started her business with funds she received from her husband. With her new loan, she plans to buy 20 pieces of clothing for resale. Luanda's aims are to expand her business and to educate her children. She is thankful to Hekima for their aid to women in poverty who are excluded from traditional banking outlets.

loans.use: to buy 20 pieces of clothing for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 54 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Cecilia has a tombstone-making business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this work. She has requested a loan to enlarge her tombstone-making business.

Cecilia has been a member of PMPC for 16 years. She hopes to have more savings in the future.

loans.use: to enlarge her tombstone-making business.

loans.name: Renerio

texts.en:
Renerio, 63, is married with two children. For the past two years he has driven a jeepney, a popular form of Philippine transportation (the jeepney was originally made from old World War II jeeps). Each month he earns approximately 15,000 PHP.

Renerio became a member of PMPC last year. He is applying for a 5,000 PHP loan to do some maintenance on his jeepney. He hopes to see his business grow.

loans.use: do some maintenance on his jeepney.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is married, with seven children. She is 41 years old and lives in Liloy-Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. 

Marilou sells RTW (ready-to-wear clothing) to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan for PHP 8,500 for additional capital to purchase RTW. Marilou has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for two years. In the future, Marilou hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more RTW (ready-to-wear clothing).

loans.name: Sherly

texts.es:
Sherly, de 29 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Luis, su esposo desde hace 7 años. Ambos tienen una hija, que hace algunos meses iluminó su casa. Y juntos vive en su casa propia.
Desde joven comenzó a trabajar por si sola. Pues su lema es “progresar”.  Su principal actividad es la venta de comida, en sus inicios tenía un restaurante donde vendía comida casera. Con el tiempo adquirió un lugar más atractivo, pues se ubicaba en una zona céntrica donde alquiló un espacio grande; ahí comenzó a vender tamales, café, jugos y bebidas diversas y pequeños aperitivos. Ella trabaja sin descanso de lunes a domingo sin parar, ya que de esa manera obtendrá buenos resultados. A la par con su crecimiento, afrontó un nuevo reto, se casó y conformó una familia, la que ahora se fortaleza con la llegado de su primer hijo. Su objetivo ahora, es invertir en su restaurante y hacerlo conocido. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “los emprendedores” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anterior crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Sherly, invertirá el dinero en la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos y si el dinero le alcanza podrá colocar mayólicas en el piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Sherly, 29, is a very hardworking woman.  She lives with Luis, her husband of seven years.  They have a daughter, who illuminated their home a few months ago.  And they live together in their own house.

She began to work on her own when she was young.  Her motto is "to progress."  Her main activity is selling food.  In the beginning she had a restaurant where she sold home-cooked food.  In time she acquired a more attractive place located in a central area where she rented a large space and began to sell tamales, coffee, juice, and a variety of beverages and small appetizers.  She works without rest from Monday through Sunday because this way she'll get good results.

On a par with her growth, she confronted a new challenge, got married, and started a family, which is now strengthened with the arrival of her first child.  Her goal now is to invest in her restaurant and make it known.

She belongs to Los Emprendedores Solidarity Group and this is their seventh loan with MFP.  She hopes for a small loan so she can achieve her objectives.  She also promises to make her payments punctually as she did with her previous loan.  In addition, she likes being part of her group because all the members are responsible and supportive people.

Sherly will invest the money in buying supplies to make her dishes.  If there's enough money left over she'll be able to put tiles on the floor of her house.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make her dishes

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela, age 42 and unmarried, sells fruits and vegetables to earn an income. Her business has been in operation for a period of 10 years, earning an income of KES 14,620 monthly. She has three children, ages four, nine, and 15 years old.

She is servicing her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET Ltd and intends to use her loan funds to purchase more vegetables and fruits to offer for sale. The profits she earns will be used to invest back into the business and to educate her children.

She hopes to improve the living standards of her family and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and fruits to offer for sale

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie, age 48, runs a general store business where she sells such items as noodles, canned goods, and liquors. She has operated this business for three years. Each month, she earns 10,000 doing this type of work. She and her husband have eight children and live in Galingon, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Rosemarie has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 7,000, which she will employ as additional capital in order to purchase noodles, canned goods, liquors, and other goods to sell in her store. Rosemarie has been a member of PMPC for four years. 

In the future, Rosemarie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, canned goods, liquors, and other goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Junela

texts.en:
Junela has operated a rice farm with her husband for more than 10 years now. They live in Ubay, Bohol, with their four young children. Her husband also works as a carpenter.
 
Junela is requesting a loan in order to buy additional seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm. With these farm inputs, they will be able to improve their farming business.

In the future, Junela dreams of making their business a success and saving enough money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma, age 35, has operated a sari-sari (general store) business for the past 11 years. Each month, she earns PhP 10,000 doing this type of work. She lives with her husband and their three children in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City.
 
Alma has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 14,900, which she will use as additional capital to buy essential items to sell in her sari-sari store. Alma has been a member of PMPC for three years.  
 
In the future, Alma hopes to build savings.

loans.use: to buy essential items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana, age 49 and unmarried, runs a sari-sari (general store) business. She has been involved in this venture for five years and earns approximately PhP 5,000 per month. She lives in Lower Langcangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental.

Rosana has requested a loan in order to buy additional inventory to offer for sale from her sari-sari store. She has been a member of PMPC for one year.
 
In the future, Rosana hopes to build savings.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to offer for sale from her sari-sari store

loans.name: Pepe

texts.es:
Pepe, de 71 años, es un hombre que siempre esta en actividad y pendiente de sus responsabilidades, es conviviente con su pareja Elza, con quien tiene 04 hijos los cuales  ya son mayores son independientes y viven con su propia familia. Vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja y tres nietos a quien cuida.
Pepe tiene un trabajo que consiste en la siembra de productos regionales, se dedica a cuidar su chacra en donde tiene productos regionales diversos pero a lo que mas se dedica es al sembrío de ají charapita (un tipo de ahí regional) que tiene en un huerto especial en su chacra, además el tiene una pequeña venta de gasolina en su casa que se encarga de atender su pareja, vende pollo, hielos y bebidas heladas.
Le gusta mucho su trabajo por que tiene tiempo para poder hacer todas sus actividades y poder estar también a lado de sus nietos, tiene buenos clientes a quienes atiende muy cordialmente los cuales están a la espera que salga de su chacra semanalmente para comprar sus diversos y frescos productos. Espera poder mantener el ritmo en su actividad económica porque tiene ingresos muy buenos y cono esto cubre los gastos diversos de su hogar. Este  será el crédito  número 18 con la institución MFP. Por ello solicita de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes, además está muy comprometido en pagar una vez mas con las cutas a tiempo y de manera responsable, se siente muy cómodo en su banco comunal ya que sus compañeros de grupo son muy responsables y siempre se solidarizan con los demás. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará granos para sembrar, además de comprar productos para venta de su casa bebidas y otros.
texts.en:
Pepe, 71 years old, is a man who is always working and looking after his responsibilities.  He lives with his partner Elza, with whom he has 4 children who are now older, independent and live with their own families.  He lives in his own house with his partner and three grandchildren that they take care of.

Pepe has a job that consists of growing regional products.  He works and cares for his small farm where he has diverse regional products, but what he works on most is his field of "charapita" peppers, a type of regional pepper.  He has these peppers in a special garden within his small farm. Additionally, he has a small gas station in his home that his wife looks after, selling chicken, ice and cold drinks.

He enjoys his work a lot because he has time to be able to do all of his business and be able to also be with his grandchildren.  He has good clients that he attends to very cordially, and they wait each week to buy his diverse and fresh products.  He would like to be able to maintain the rhythm of his business because he has a good income and it covers the diverse expenses of his home.  

This will be loan number 18 with MFP. For it he asks for your collaboration so he can settle on his plans. He is very committed to once again paying his quotas on time and in a responsible way.  He is very comfortable with his communal bank since the other group members are very responsible and always show each other support.  With the requested amount of 2000 soles, he will buy grains to grow, as well as products to sell from his home like drinks, etc.

loans.use: to buy grains for growing, as well as buy drink and other products to sell from his house

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es: La Sra. GISELA  tiene 32 años, ella se dedica al comercio minorista, ofreciendo variedad de productos incensios,  ambientador, y sahumerios,  ella  vende en su tienda que se encuentra en la zona de Bajo Pacajes,  La Sra. GISELA ,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución,  La Sra. GISELA  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de incensios  al por mayor,  La Sra. GISELA  enfrenta retos en su negocio que es la demanda que hay de nuevos productos y va a utilizar los beneficios en una mejor atención y comprando variedad de productos, La Sra. GISELA  se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Sra. Gisela is 32-years old.  She makes her living in retail.  She sells a variety of incense, air freshening and aromatic products.  She has a store located in the Bajo Pacajes zone.  This is Sra. Gisela's second loan with the institution.  She is going to use the loan to purchase wholesale incense.  Sra. Gisela faces challenges in her business, like the demand for new products.  She is going to use the loan to purchase a variety of products and thereby offer an improved service to her customers.  Sra. Gisela feels happy about and grateful to the institution for the help they are providing in granting her the loan.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale incense.

loans.name: Ritchelle

texts.en:
Ritchelle is 32 years old and lives in Calamba-Lusot, Baliangao. She is married, with no children. Ritchelle has a shop that sells groceries and beverages. She has had this business for two years. 

Ritchelle requested a loan to redeem a parcel of cocoland that had been pawned. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for a year.

loans.use: to redeem a parcel of cocoland that had been pawned.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy, age 49, has been a teacher for 23 years. She was inspired into service by her mother, who was passionate about the profession. To supplement her low salary, she runs a piggery business. She and her husband have four children and live in Masindi, Uganda.

Dorothy's dream is to venture into an expanded business by eventually owning at least 200 pigs.

Dorothy intends to use the loan funds to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida, age 30, is a fish vendor. She has been engaged in his venture for three years. She lives with her husband and their two children in Mohon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.
 
Nida has requested a loan to use as capital for her fish vending business. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. 

In the future, Nida hopes to build savings.

loans.use: to add capital for her fish vending business

loans.name: Carlosa

texts.en:
Carlosa is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is requesting PhP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for fishing.

Carlosa has successfully paid back her previous loan and is requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Carlosa 's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Wilson Kipngetich

texts.en:
Wilson, age 37, runs a local butcher shop in Chemundu. The business has been in operation for a period of four years now and his monthly income has increased to KES 11,050. He lives with his wife and their two children, ages seven and 13.

Wilson is servicing his fifth loan in the amount of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd after repaying the previous one successfully. He intends to use his loan funds to purchase sheep and goats, which he will eventually slaughter and to sell to his esteemed customers. The expected profits will be used to repay the loan and to pay school fees for his children.  

He hopes to improve the living standards of her family and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: La Sra. Doris sigue con la misma actividad de la elaboración y  venta de pan cuenta que le fue muy bien con el crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de un horno de mayor capacidad y ahora incremento su producción, ahora en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de harina, manteca y demás insumos para la elaboración de pan ya que en este último tiempo incremento su clientela.
texts.en:
Doris continues with the same job making and selling bread.  Speaking about it, she said the loan went very well because she used it to buy an oven with a greater capacity and now she has increased her production.

She's requesting this loan to buy flour, shortening, and other supplies to make bread because lately her clientele has expanded.

loans.use: to buy shortening and flour to make bread

loans.name: Ylaria

texts.es:
Ylaria de 28 años, viuda y madre de 2 lindos motivos de vida Franklin de 9 años y Netsy de 4 son la principal fuente de motivación que pose.
Comparte junto a sus pequeños una vivienda construida a base de adobe que adquirió con su difunto esposo. Dedicada a las actividades productivas consistentes en el mantenimiento de café viene brindándoles a sus pequeños lo mejor de si en cuanto a educación se trata. Lleva 6 años en el rubro y siente que  es una actividad muy tranquila y sin presiones de por medio.
Para facilitar su labor en el campo cuenta constantemente con el apoyo de jornaleros quienes apoyan principalmente en actividades de deshierbo por ser complicadas.
Le agrada mucho su trabajo puesto que las ganancias son rentables al cabo de fin de campaña.
Al iniciarse un nuevo año planea dedicarle mayor atención a las plantaciones de café por poseer parcelas muy fértiles para dicho producto por consiguiente necesita realizar un préstamo a su entidad financiera.
Tiene en mente a futuro iniciar la construcción de su vivienda  a base de material noble en beneficio del bienestar de sus pequeños hijos para los cuales dedica todo su trabajo. Con motivo de priorizar la producción de café desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de plantas de café así pagar a los jornaleros y la adquisición de sacos con abono guano de aves.
texts.en:
Ylaria is 28 years old, widowed and the mother of two beautiful children, Franklin, 9, and Netsy, 4.  They are the biggest source of her motivation.  With her children she shares a building constructed with an adobe base that she acquired from her late husband. She is dedicated to her business, which consists of maintaining coffee plants.  She brings her children the best in the form of education.  She has spent 6 years in this role and feels that it is a very calm business without pressures in between seasons.

To facilitate her labor in the field she counts on the support of day laborers constantly, who primarily help with weeding because it is complex.  She likes her work a lot because her earnings are profitable at the end of the season.

To begin a new year she plans to dedicate more attention to her coffee fields in order to have very fertile plots for said product, because later she will need to pay back the loan to her financial entity.

She has in mind beginning the construction of her home with a base of superior quality wood for the benefit of the well-being of her small children, for whom she dedicates all of her work.  With motivation to prioritize the production of coffee, she would like to count on 2,000 nuevos soles to buy coffee plants, as well as pay day laborers and acquire sacks of fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants, pay day laborers and acquire sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Sarkhan

texts.en:
Sarkhan, age 49, is a farmer. He has been farming vegetables like tomatoes, cucumbers, dates, and pomegranates on his own land for 28 years. He sells the harvested fruits and vegetables at the local bazaar. He and his wife have a 25-year-old son.

Since the business is Sarkhan's primary source of income, he spends almost all of his time trying to develop it. He earns additional money from doing repair work. 
 
The reason he has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,000 AZN is to make essential repairs to his own house. His goal is for his house to have a neat appearance for the wedding of his son.

loans.use: to make essential repairs to his own house in preparation for the wedding of his son

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela, age 66, is a coconut farmer. She and her husband live in Burgos, Aloran Misamis Occidental, Philippines, and have raised four children.

Adela has requested a loan in order to redeem pawned land. She has been a member of PMPC for five years. 

In the future, Adela hopes to build savings.

loans.use: to redeem pawned land

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia, age 61, is a corn farmer. She has been engaged in this work for three years. She and her husband live in San Isidro, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, and have raised five children.

Rosalia has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000, which she will employ as additional working capital to buy fertilizer for her corn plantation. She has been a member of PMPC for three years. 

In the future, Rosalia hopes to expand her farm to include other crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her corn plantation

location.town: Liloy-San Isidro, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 24-year-old single man. He lives with his parents and only one sibling at their modest house in one of the Lebanese villages. 

Hasan spent the last three years working in his own shop where he sells all kinds of electronics. He has owned this shop for three years. But he’s not the only one covering the family’s expenses. His father is also supplementing the family’s income.  

Hasan always wanted to better develop his business and improve his work as well, but until now he has been earning a barely fair income. For that reason, he decided to take a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a fair quantity of new and modern electronic items.  

He confirms that the loan will help him increase his sales, since he will respond rapidly to his clients’ demands. And as Hasan wishes to increase his earnings, he also wishes to become an electrical equipment wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase a fair quantity of new and modern electronic items.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem, age 46, is a very hard-working and efficient tailor. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and children. She has been operating her small tailoring business for the last few years, providing tailoring services in her community. All of her clients appreciate her for her excellent skills.  

She is requesting financing in order to invest in buying a tailoring machine and tailoring materials, such as cloth, machine oil, and packs of thread. Naseem is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her business and bring about positive changes in the life of their family.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a tailoring machine and tailoring materials, such as cloth, machine oil, and packs of thread

loans.name: Nety

texts.en:
Nety is 61 years old and lives in Calamba-Tugas, Baliangao. She is married, with one child. Nety has a shop that sells groceries and beverages. She has had this business for almost two years. 

Nety requested a loan to purchase additional inventory to sell. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for almost three years.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for her grocery store.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah, age 24 and unmarried, offers transportation services in Kapkangani. The business has been in operation for a period of two years, earning Noah an income of KES 20,000 monthly.

He is now servicing his third loan in the amount of KES 50,000 from KADET Ltd after repaying the previous one successfully. He intends to add this amount to money he has already saved so as to purchase a new motorcycle for his transportation business. The expected profits will be used to purchase a plot and to develop it. 

He hopes to live a happy life and prosper in his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle for his transportation business

loans.name: Crisilda

texts.en:
Crisilda is married with three children. She is 34 years old and lives in Caputol, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.

Crisilda is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizer. 

Crisilda has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, she hopes to earn more savings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 50 years old and lives in Tawi-Tawi, Aloran Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Lolita works in the fishing industry and catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 4 years. She has requested a loan to add capital to her fishing business. 

Lolita has been a member of PMPC for 12 years. In the future, Lolita hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to add capital to her fishing business.

loans.name: Lorena Angelica

texts.es:
Lorena  vive en las orquídeas . tiene30años. es soltera , tiene tres hijos menores de edad . Ella Tomo la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguirle dándoles los estudios a sus hijos sus estudios; Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar. Ella decidio juntar dinero  que tenia para dar apertura  a su negocio de venta  en general.

En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  una clientela  .Lorena trabaja en su negocio  diariamente , ella se levanta a las 6 am de la mañana , va a dejar a sus niños a la escuela. Con el préstamo comprara  joyas, ropa, varios etc. Su meta es seguir dándoles los estudios a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio y su vivienda
texts.en:
Lorena lives in Las Orquídeas. She is 30 years old, single, and has three young children. Lorena decided to find work so that she could continue providing for her children’s education, but no one was offering job opportunities. She decided to gather the money that she had in order to start a general retail business.

At the moment, her business is growing gradually and now she has a customer base. Lorena works at her business every day. She wakes up at 6:00 A.M. so that she can take her children to school.

With this loan, she will buy jewelry, clothing, and various other items. Her goals include continuing to provide for her children’s education and to improve both her business and her home.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, clothing, and other items.

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri is from Kapan town. She lives with her husband and two sons who are attending school. Together with her husband, Karen, Meri opened a little shop where she trades in accessories, toys and flowers. 

Thanks to her kind attitude toward customers, Meri's shop is in demand. In order to satisfy her customers’ needs, Meri needs to purchase supplies. So, she has requested this loan to purchase dish accessories and supplies. This will increase sales and help her to get more income.

The loan is very important for Meri and her husband to have a high income and ensure a better future for their children.

loans.use: to pay for dish accessories and supplies for the shop.

loans.name: Celia Eugenia

texts.es: La  Sra. Celia tiene 26 años, casada, tiene dos hijos de las edades de 5 y 8, La  Sra. Celia  se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, dulces, refrescos y variedad de artículos en su tienda de barrio,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La  Sra. Celia va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de abarrotes para surtir su negocio como arroz, fideo, harina y azúcar por mayor para surtir su tienda  y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, La  Sra. Celia va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, ya que esta época es de mucha demanda,  su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela.
texts.en:
Celia is 26 years old, married, and has 2 children, ages 5 and 8. In her neighborhood store she sells a variety of articles of primary necessity, including groceries, sweets, soft drinks, and a variety of other items.

This loan is part of the 1st cycle  of loans offered by our institution. Celia will use the  loan to buy a variety of groceries to supply her store, such as rice, beans, wheat flour, and sugar, at wholesale to stock her store. In this manner, she will offer a greater variety of products to her customers. Her reason for soliciting this loan is to continue improving her business. 

Celia will utilize the benefits to continue purchasing products and thus, improving her income. Especially since in this season there is much demand. Her future desire for her business is to have a general store and thus, offer better service to her clientele.

loans.use: to be able to purchase a supply of products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Stalin Dionicio

texts.es: Stalin vive en las orquídeas. Tiene 32 años. Es casado tiene dos hijos menores de edad. El Toma la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir  con los estudios de su hijo, salir adelante. Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. El decide juntar dinero que tenia para dar apertura  a su negocio de taxista  en general.   En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  pasajero necesario Stalin  trabaja diariamente  en su negocio El trabaja a las 6 am hasta las 10 p m. Con el préstamo comprara  materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa. Su meta es mejorar  su vivienda  y poder seguir con su negocio.
texts.en: Stalin lives in Las Orquídeas.  He is 32 years old.  He is married and has two young children.  He made the decision to look for work so his son could continue his education and to get ahead.  As he could not find work at a business, he decided to use the money he had to start a taxi business.  Currently, his business has grown little by little to the point where he gets enough passengers.  Stalin works every day from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m.  He will use this loan to buy construction materials to make improvements to his home.  His goal is to make his home better and to continue with his business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Iris Consuelo

texts.es: Doña iris tiene 48 años, su pareja trabaja como docente en una universidad, tienen dos hijos de 25 y 26 cada uno dependiente y trabajando, tiene el negocio de la venta de plátanos en el mercado de Managua comercializados de su propia finca que administra uno de sus hijos, el crédito lo necesita para construir el porche de la casa para brindarle mayor comodidad a su familia con esta construcción la casa se verá más amplia y sus nietos podrán jugar contentos, para ello necesita comprar cemento, bloques, arena, hierro, piedrines, pagar la mano de obra para continuar la obra.
texts.en:
Doña Iris is 48 years old. Her partner works as an instructor at a university. They have two children, ages 25 and 26, both of whom are dependents and working.

Iris has a business selling bananas at a market in Managua. The bananas she sells are from her farm that is managed by one of her children. The loan she is requesting will be used to build a porch for her house in order to provide more comfortable conditions for her family. As a result, this construction project will expand her house, thus allowing her grandchildren to play freely.

Iris needs to buy cement, blocks, sand, iron, and gravel. She will also pay for labor so that the work can continue.

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks, sand, iron, gravel, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52 years old and lives in South Mapang, Rizal. She is married with one child. 

Teresita works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 8 years. She has requested a loan to purchase 5 boxes of fish to sell. 

Teresita has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase 5 boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and three siblings. Regardless of his young age, he is doing the best he can to collect money and have his own family and children. 

Mohammad’s father is the only source of income in the family, and on his own is taking on all expenses and responsibilities. Not to forget that Mohammad is a great support for him. For this reason, Mohammad decided to open a poultry shop a few years ago after almost two years of experience in this occupation. He is well known for his generosity and good products. 

Today, Mohammad is looking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new freezer and enlarge his business. In that way, he will be able to maintain the food in good conditions. He notes that this will return high profits for him. 

In the future, he seeks to open his own snack business.

loans.use: to purchase a new freezer and enlarge his business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 26 years old, and married with a child living in Masindi–Uganda. She has been a teacher for 8 months. Her parents inspired her to become a teacher since they were both in the same profession.

Like all government employees she has a low salary while her dreams are to upgrade her studies, build a permanent house for her residence and venture into a retail shop business. Lucia intends to use the loan to buy cement and sand to construct her residential house.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to construct her residential house.

loans.name: Marie Josee

texts.en: Marie Josee is 30 years old. She is married with four children. The oldest is twelve and the youngest is five. She has been in the business of selling fabrics and threads for 10 years. Her husband is a photographer. She wants a loan to buy more fabrics and other items used in sewing to sell. The profit from the business will be used to pay for school fees for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics and other items for resale.

loans.name: Sayuni

texts.en:
Sayuni is a 32-year-old hardworking woman living in the town of Masindi, Uganda. She operates a drug shop, and practices farming as her additional income source.  

Her business is located in the urban area on a busy street where customers have easy access.  High license and labor fees hinder her business profits. Her dream is to own a pharmacy.

Sayuni intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Sebastiana Francisca

texts.es: Sebastiana vive en orquídeas. Tiene 34  años. Es soltera  tiene un  hijos de 16 años. Ella a raíz de su separación de su ex pareja toma la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir  adelante  seguir con los estudios de su hijo. Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. Ella decide juntar dinero para dar apertura  a su negocio de  comida rápida en general  En la actualidad su ventas poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  clientela  necesaria Sebastiana  trabaja diariamente con su hijo que la ayuda. Ella trabaja desde la mañana  .Con el préstamo  ella comprara  productos de cocina, legumbre, varios, etc. su meta es tener su gran comedor y mejorar su vivienda
texts.en: Sebastiana lives in the Orquídeas neighborhood of Guayaquil. She is 34 years old, single, and has a 16 year-old son.  Upon separating from her ex-partner, she decided to look for work so that she could get ahead and pay for her son's education.  As no one was giving her an opportunity to work for a company, she decided to gather together some money to open her own fast food business.  Her sales grew gradually until she had the customers she needed.  Sebastiana works each day, and her son helps her.  She works starting in the morning.  With this loan, she will buy food products, such as vegetables and other items.  Her goals are to have a big restaurant and to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy food products for her business selling food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rent agricultural land, buy seeds for cultivation, and buy forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Annjaffel

texts.en:
Annjaffel is a 23-year-old woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has been running a sari-sari, or variety store business, for more than three years. 

She sells various goods and items to people at her store.  Annjaffel would like to expand her business, but lacks the capital to do so. Because of this, she is applying for a loan from CEVI to buy additional merchandise to sell such as canned goods, candies, bread, snack foods, soap and toiletries. 

With this loan, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store. 

In the future, Annjaffel wants to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, candies, bread, snack foods, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Francisca has been in this business for 4 years. Francisca earns additional income from her coffee shop.

Francisca has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 53-year-old ambitious man living in Masindi, Uganda. He is married, and charged with the responsibility of taking care of 11 children;  all are able to acquire an education.

He operates a retail shop, selling general merchandise.  He has been in this business for 11 years.  He started the business to meet the daily needs of his family, since farming is seasonal.  

His dreams are to educate his children, and expand his business to new markets, despite the challenges of price fluctuation and theft. 

Peter intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as milk, sugar, and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as milk, sugar, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Garnik

texts.en:
Garnik is 57 years old, and lives in Ararat town. He lives with his wife and two sons, who are attending school.

Garnik owns agricultural land where he grows 120 peach and 130 apricot trees. He is very hardworking person, and does his best to have a good harvest.  Unfortunately, his income is not enough to cover all the basic needs of the family. 

So, Garnik has requested this loan to purchase seeds. This will help him to gather more income, and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia de 34 años, Natural del distrito de Santa Rosa región Ayacucho, comparte una vida conyugal con Félix de 38 años. Madre de 3 menores: Emerson, Erica y Ruth.
Reside junto a su familia en una vivienda construida a base de Material noble que construyo con ayuda de su pareja. Se instruyó en las actividades productivas de cacao orgánico desde muy niña logrando convertirlo con el paso de los años en el principal sustento de su hogar. Lleva más de 10 años como productora independiente en unas parcelas que adquirió junto a Félix con motivo de buscar un sustento sólido para su hogar.
Le agrada mucho su trabajo ya que esta acostumbrada a pasar muchas horas en el campo realizando sus labores cotidianas junto a los jornaleros que contrata para un trabajo fluido. No obstante los días de lluvia impiden dirigirse a sus parcelas ya que el acceso se vuelve muy inestable a causa del lodo.
A manera realizar una mejora un su producción planea reemplazar árboles de cacao desfasados y usar el tallo de estos para iniciarse en la producción de injertos para el cual es necesario contar con capital para la compra de las plantas de almácigo.
Sus planes a futuro apuntan a la compra de un vehículo carguero con el cual espera facilitar el transporte de sus productos a su localidad para su posterior venta a los acopiadores. Requiere contar para la presente campaña con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de plantas de almácigo y abono guano de isla esperando reemplazar las plantaciones desfasadas.
texts.en:
Thirty-four-year-old Virginia is from Santa Rosa in the region of Ayacucho.  She lives with her partner, 38-year-old Félix.  She is the mother of three young children, Emerson, Erica, and Ruth.

She lives with her family in a house made of fine materials that she built with the help of her partner.  She learned the business of growing organic cacao when she was very young and, with the passage of time, she has been able to make it the primary source of support for her household.  For over 10 years she has been an independent grower on some plots of land she got with Félix in order to ensure reliable support for her household. 

She likes her work very much, as she is used to spending many hours in the field doing the daily tasks alongside the laborers she hires so the work goes smoothly.  Nevertheless, rainy days keep her from getting to her land, as access to it becomes very unstable because of mud.  

She plans to improve her yield by replacing cacao trees that are out of phase and using their stalks to start making grafts.  In order to do this, she needs capital to buy gumbo-limbo plants.

Her plans for the future are all directed toward buying a cargo vehicle, which she hopes will make transporting her produce to the place she sells to collectors easier.  For this season, she needs 1,000 nuevos soles to buy gumbo-limbo plants and guano fertilizer in hopes of replacing her out-of-phase crops.

loans.use: to buy gumbo-limbo plants and bird-guano fertilizer

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: La Sra. Juliana tiene 37 años es casada tiene cuatro hijos que tienen la edad de 16, 13, 10 y 7 años, ella se dedica a la confección de chalecos de tela polar, ella se dedica a esta actividad hace ya varios años, su taller se encuentran ubicado en la zona de Pampahasi, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Juliana  utilizara este préstamo para compra de maquina over y  telas por rollo para la confección de sus chalecos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital de trabajo, La Sra. Juliana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son seguir mejorando la calidad de la confección de las prendas de vestir y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir aumentando  su  capital de trabajo su deseo para su negocio es crecer y confeccionar variedad de prendas de vestir, La Sra. Juliana se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Juliana, 37, is married and has 4 children aged 16, 13, 10 and 7.  She has a business making vests out of polar fleece.  She has been doing this kind of work for a number of years; her workshop is located in the Pampahasi neighborhood.  This loan is her first with the institution.  Juliana will use this loan to buy an overlock sewing machine and bolts of fabric to make her vests.  She is requesting this loan because she lacks working capital.  Juliana faces challenges in her business, including improving the quality of her garments.  She will use the profits to continue to increase her working capital.  Juliana wants her business to grow, and to make a variety of different garments.  Juliana feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support being provided.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and bolts of fabric

loans.name: Zakariya

texts.en:
Zakariya is a 20-year-old man. He is single and lives in Lebanon with his parents and four siblings. Two of them are working in addition to their father, who is considered the main income provider for the family.

Despite his young age, Zakariya is obliged to work continually, as he wishes to have his own family and children, plus he wishes to support his family as much as he possibly can. 

Zakariya has been working in the construction field since 2010. He specializes in gypsum decorations and has gained a fair number of clients asking for his services. Regardless of being satisfied with what he has attained so far, he suffers from a bad financial situation. That is the reason why he is asking today for a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. He will use the loan to improve his business by purchasing a new car, as he plans to take on bigger projects all over the surrounding areas. 

In the near future, he plans to take additional loans to open his own gypsum boards shop. This is how he works really hard to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to improve his business by purchasing a new car.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 58 years old, married and a father of eight children between 30 and eight years old. He is a farmer on a tea plantation and has been in operation for a period of five years earning a monthly income of KES. 10,000.

He has borrowed a loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD this being his fourth  loan, and wishes to use this amount to purchase green tea leaves for resale.  

The profits he earns will be used to expand his tea plantation by tilling more land and planting crops. He hopes to live a happy life with his family and to expand his tea plantations.

loans.use: to purchase fresh green tea leaves.

loans.name: Rovena

texts.en:
Rovena is a 23-year-old married mother of two young children. They are Romas, and live in south-central Albania in a major city where majority of their community lives. She is described by others as a hard-working lady; she works as a janitor every day, while she sells used items, mostly clothes, at the market.
 
Rovena has got plans; she wants to improve their living conditions, and educate her children. “And the only way to do this is by working hard,” she said. “In my community, we’ve gotten used to not educating our children, yet, now we see more and more of our children being sent to school, and this is nice."

She is now requesting a loan for the first time, because she wants to buy more second-hand clothes and resell them. The amount she needs is 100,000 ALL( Albanian Lek).

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes to resell at the market.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 43 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soap, sugar, and school supplies.

Ellen has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years, and also earns an income from tricycle transportation.

Ellen aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soap, sugar, and school supplies.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 52 years old and married with three children.

Victoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store. Prior to this loan, Victoria has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Victoria aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Karmelle Margie

texts.en:
Karmelle Margie is a 21-years-old woman from the province of Bohol in Philippines. She has run a sari-sari, or variety store, business for several years now. She sells various goods and commodities to the people in her place.  This is the source of her income.

Karmelle Margie wants to take a loan to buy additional inventory to sell like chips and snack foods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. Through this, she will be able to improve her store and attract more customers and buyers into her store.

In the future, Karmelle Margie hopes to make her business a success and save money for the future schooling of her three-years-old daughter.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell like chips and snack foods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en: Josiane is married with two children, the oldest is 9 and the youngest is 7. Her husband is a businessman. She has been in the retail business for 12 years. She wants a loan to buy more cloth. With the profit she will pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to make clothes to sell.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en: Belinda is a 36-year-old woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has been running a sari-sari or variety store business for more than ten years now. Belinda is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks of canned goods, candies, bread, snack food, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to sell more and cater to more customers in her store. In the future, Belinda dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Gloria Rosmira

texts.es: Gloria de 51 años es casada y madre de dos hijos menores de edad. Se ha dedicado a las labores de ama de casa y a cuidar de sus hijos. Hace algunos años la situación en su hogar no fue la mejor por lo cual se empleó para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos. En el tiempo que estuvo laborando decidió estudiar el oficio de encuadernación. Cuando aprendió completamente la actividad se retiró de su empleo y decidió independizarse y laborar desde su casa. En la actualidad esta actividad ha permitido mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia y les ha dado a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar. Con el fin de mejorar las ventas, Gloria se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de materia prima par la elaboración de pastas de cuadernos, con el propósito de ser comercializados en la temporada escolar que se avecina y que ocasiona un aumento en las ventas de útiles escolares.
texts.en: Fifty-one-year-old Gloria is married and the mother of two young children.  She has been a housewife and full-time mom.  A few years ago, her home situation was not the best, so she worked for a while to help her husband with the expenses.  During the time she was working, she decided to study bookbinding.  When she learned how to do it completely, she left her job and decided to work independently from home.  Currently, this business allows her to improve her family's finances and it has given her children the opportunity to get an education.  In order to improve her sales, Gloria is asking for a loan she will invest in raw materials to make notebook covers so she can sell them during the upcoming school season, which causes an increase in sales of school supplies.

loans.use: To buy bookbinding supplies and a bookshelf.

loans.name: Joaquín

texts.es:
Joaquín tiene 46 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo. Desde pequeño se ha dedicado a trabajar en el cultivo de granos básicos como maíz y fríjol para sostener a su familia. Además, él participa activamente en la iglesia siendo catequista. A través de los años don Joaquín ha asistido a diferentes cursillos de elaboración de medicina natural que fueron impartidas en la iglesia y durante el conflicto armado en el país le enseñaron a elaborar pastas naturales para medicina. Hace un año compro un molino para moler plantas medicinales y es así como elabora sus productos.  Para comprar la materia prima, que necesita para elaborar la medicina tiene que viajar a la ciudad, para ello debe caminar de quince a veinte minutos a pie hasta llegar al lugar en donde aborda el autobús. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar materiales para mejorar el techo de su casa y para comprar materia prima para elaborar la medicina. Con la inversión, podrá reparar el techo de su casa, para estar listo para la temporada lluviosa y dispondrá de suficiente medicina para ofrecer a sus clientes ya que él sale a venderla de manera ambulante. Su deseo, es instalar su propio negocio de venta de medicina natural en la ciudad y brindarle el estudio a su hijo.
texts.en:
Joaquín is 46 years of age, married, and has one son. From a young age he has worked growing basic grains, such as corn and beans, to support his family. He also participates actively in the church, where he is a catechist. Over the years Joaquín has taken various courses to prepare natural medicines which were given in the church. During the armed conflict that took place in his country, he was also taught how to make natural pastes for medicinal use. A year ago he bought a mill to grind medicinal plants, and this is how he prepares his products. Joaquín needs to travel to the city to buy the raw materials he needs to prepare his medicines, and has to walk between 15 and 20 minutes to the spot where he catches the bus. 

The loan Joaquín has requested from Fundación Campo is to buy materials to improve the roof of his house, as well as to buy raw materials to prepare medicines. With this investment, he will be able to repair the roof on his house so that he is ready for the rainy season. He will also have enough medicine to offer his customers, to whom he sells by traveling to different neighborhoods. His wish is to have his own natural medicine business in the city, and to provide for his son’s education.

loans.use: To buy materials to improve the roof of his house, as well as to buy raw materials to use to make medicine.

loans.name: Gabriela Del Rosario

texts.es: La  Sra. Gabriela tiene 32 años, tiene 3 hijos que tiene la edad de 5, 9, y 14 años,  se dedica a la venta de comida  una zona muy concurrida de la ciudad de La Paz,   Este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución la    Sra. Gabriela va a usar este préstamo para Invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas, como arroz, fideo, papa y aceite por mayor Su razón para solicitar este préstamo por la falta de capital, La  Sra. Gabriela enfrenta retos en su negocio ya que los  precios han subido y muchas veces los insumos  escasean y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando insumos, para la elaboración de sus comidas, La  Sra. Gabriela es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo  brindado.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a 32-year-old woman who has three children aged 5, 9 and 14.  She sells food in a very busy area in the city of La Paz.  This is her second loan from this institution.

She will use the loan in order to buy supplies at wholesale to make her food items, such as rice, noodles, potatoes and oil.  She is seeking the loan as she currently lacks working capital.  She faces challenges in her business as the prices of the goods she sells have fallen.  Also, many times the supplies she needs are scarce. 

Gabriela is a very hardworking person and is happy and grateful to the institution for their support.

loans.use: to buy supplies at wholesale.

loans.name: Festo

texts.en:
Festo is 46 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 12 years, Festo has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, milk and bread. 

To help expand her business, Festo has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy commodities such as milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale, and will help Festo to generate greater profits and provide her clients with the best items. Festo hopes that in the future she will be able to her children the best education. 

Festo is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Festo who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia de 51 años es una madre muy abnegada, viuda y con un gran corazón de mujer tiene el orgullo de haber educado a sus dos hijos hoy ya mayores y convertirlos en personas con muchos valores y amor por el trabajo. Es poseedora de una vivienda construida a base de adobe.
Es propietaria de unas parcelas las cuales destino a la producción de café cuya ubicación se halla a  5 kilómetros de su localidad.
Lleva más de 30 años en el rubro y espera seguir trabajando con el entusiasmo que la caracteriza ya que siente que las fuerzas y las ganas de trabajar son lo que le sobran.
Le agrada su actividad puesto que recuerda sus mejores momentos familiares en el campo.
Para realizar sus actividades de manera fluida cuenta constantemente con el apoyo de jornaleros quienes la apoyan en las diversas actividades que forzosas ya.
Actualmente planea expandir sus plantaciones de café en la parte alta de su parcela y debe contar con plantones de café bebe  para el cual planea acudir a su entidad financiera y solicitar un préstamo con el cual financiar su próxima campaña productiva.
Tiene en mente concretar a través de su trabajo la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble.
Requiere contar con 2,000 nuevos soles los cuales destinará a la compra de plantas de café para expandir su producción así como la contrata de jornaleros para la respectiva tarea.
texts.en:
Fifty-one-year-old Lidia is a very selfless mother.  She is a widow with a big heart who is proud to have been able to have given her children, who are now grown, an education and to have made them people with values and a love of work.  She owns an adobe home.

She owns some plots of land used to grow coffee that are 5km from her home.

She has been in this business for over 30 years and she expects to keep working with her characteristic enthusiasm, as she feels she has more than enough strength and desire to keep working. 

She likes her work because she remembers her best times with her family in the fields.

In order to make sure the work goes smoothly, she always counts on the help of laborers who help her with different tasks that are too strenuous.

She is currently planning to expand her coffee plantings into the higher part of her land and she needs baby coffee saplings.  To do this, she plans to go to her financier and ask for a loan to fund her next planting season.

She is thinking about rebuilding her home with fine materials through her work.

She needs 2,000 nuevos soles to buy coffee plants to expand her production and to hire more laborers for the work.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Lindita

texts.en:
Lindita is forty five years old and married. She has three children; one of them is still attending school. They live in the northwest of Albania and she is involved in two agricultural activities; one is animal husbandry and the other is planting crops and veggies.
 
Lindita has been practicing both of these activities for twenty-one years now, and the income she’s been generating from both has been the only one for her family. She claims that she gets help from her husband; he takes the products to the market to sell.

Lindita wants to increase the dairy products she produces, so she wants to add another dairy cow. This would be Lindita’s first loan from VisionFund Albania.

loans.use: to add another dairy cow.

loans.name: Evancy

texts.en:
Evancy is 45 years old, married, and blessed with six children aged between 3 and 17 years old. He owns a spare parts shop and has been in the business for over eight years, earning a monthly income of 19,000 KES.  

He is now requesting his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. He intends to use this loan to purchase spare parts to sell.

The anticipated profits will be used to pay school fees for his schoolgoing children and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts  for resale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy, de 43 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Félix y su hijo Jovani, al que cuida en la casa que heredó desde hace 16 años. Ella es una mujer trabajadora, desde los primeros rayos de sol se dedica la crianza de sus animales posee vacas de lecheras de buena calidad, a las que cuida con mucha dedicación ya que son delicadas, “siempre mueren de hinchazón de barriga”, afirma.  Comenta que todos los días vende los litros de leche que producen sus animales, de esa manera tiene ingresos diarios. Asimismo, como buena mujer del campo también siembra y vende comida en un espacio de su tienda de comestibles, otra de sus principales actividades económicas, hace 13 años abrió una tienda surtida con alimentos de primera necesidad por su barrio, pues no existe otra tienda igual, de esa manera puede tener un ingreso estable, además de tener clientes permanentes quienes año tras año compran sus alimentos en la tienda de Nancy. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, se siente agradecido con el apoyo obtenido, pues de esa manera se siente tranquila de invertir, además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que en su asociación le enseñaron a ser responsable.
Nancy, invertirá el dinero en la compra de sacos de arroz y azúcar, además de cajas de leche, aceite y demás productos, asimismo una vaca lechera para aumentar su ganadería.
texts.en:
Nancy, forty-three, is a hardworking woman.  She lives with her husband, Félix, and her son, Jovani, whom she takes care of in the house she inherited when she was sixteen.  She's a very hardworking woman; from the time the sun comes up she works at raising her animals; she has high-quality milk cows that she looks after with great dedication because they are very delicate.  "They are forever dying of colic," she says.  She says she sells liters of milk that her animals produce on a daily basis, and that's how she earns her living.

In addition, like a good farm woman, Nancy grows food and sells it in her eatery, another of her financial activities.  Thirteen years ago she opened up a store stocked up with foods that are basic necessities in her neighborhood because there aren't any other stores like hers, so she's able to make a stable income and have steady customers that buy food at her store year after year.  

This will be Nancy's eighth loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the support she has received because she feels comfortable investing in her business.  She promises to make her payments on time because in her group she has learned to be responsible.  She'll invest her loan in sacks of rice and sugar, as well as boxes of milk, oil and other items, and a milk cow to expand her herd.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, and boxes of milk and oil.

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José tiene 41 años de edad, tiene un hijo. Él es una persona que se ha esforzado mucho para apoyar a su hijo. Él estuvo internado en un centro de rehabilitación del alcoholismo durante dos años, ahí aprendió a vender productos de bisutería, CD, DVS, ropa de todas las edades, bolsones, entre otros productos. Hoy en día tiene once años de experiencia en ese negocio y posee dos lugares en donde los vende, una de ellas es en las escuelas de la comunidad y en la zona norte del departamento en donde vive. Antes, se dedicaba a la agricultura, a sembrar granos básicos. Es muy conocido en la zona por su sociabilidad y carisma con las personas.

Él compra su mercadería cada ocho días, se traslada a la capital para realizar las compras, debido a que los adquiere a mejor precio y aborda tres autobuses hasta llegar a su destino. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar $200 de ropa de todas las edades, $150 en la compra de CD y DVD, $100 en aritos y calcomanías, productos de bisutería $250 y $250 para comprar bolsones para estudiantes. Con la inversión, dispondrá de mayor inventario para ofertar más productos a sus clientes y más en esta época en donde inician las clases. Espera que sus ventas aumenten considerablemente para que sus ingresos sean mejores y construir una vivienda más digna y adquirir un vehiculo para trasladar la mercadería de un lugar a otro más cómodamente.
texts.en:
José is forty-one and has one child.  He's a person who has really made an effort to support his child.  He was in an alcohol rehab center for two years, where he learned how to sell costume jewelry, CDs, DVDs, clothing for all ages, backpacks, etc.  He now has eleven years' experience and has two locales, one of which is by the community schools in the area north of the department where he lives.  Previously he worked in agriculture, growing basic grains.  He is very well-known in his area for his sociability and charisma.

José buys his merchandise every eight days, traveling to the capital, where he can get them for the best prices.  He takes three buses to get there.

José is seeking a loan from Fundación Campo to buy $200 in clothing for all ages, $150 in CDs and DVDs, $100 in earrings and decals, $250 in  costume jewelry, and $250 to buy backpacks for students.
