texts.en: Jean Claude is 24 years old. He is single. He has been in business for three years. He wants a loan to buy more shirts. With the profit he will buy land.

loans.use: To buy more shirts to sell.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en: Delphine is 28 years old. She is married with a nine-month-old baby. Her husband is a businessman. She has been in business for two years. She wants the loan to buy more women's clothes. She will use the profit for her savings.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Al Rihan Group

texts.en:
Iman is the featured borrower for the Al Rihan group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. Iman is the one in the middle. She has worked as a hairdresser for 10 years to help her husband in making their living. Her business is located at home, in order to take good care of both her family and business at the same time. Iman is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her beauty products to improve her business. She is a 36-year-old married woman, and the mother of five children, four girls and one boy aged between 6 and 12 years old.

Khadija is the one on the left. She has been a housekeeper for eight years. She helps her husband in making their living and covering their children's expenses. She is a 43-year-old mother of four children, two boys and two girls aged between 11 and 20 years old. Her requested loan will be invested in paying for her children's educational fees which is a very important issue for her.

Elissar is a 22-year-old married woman and mother of one baby girl. She has been working as a tailor for three years, and she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a washing machine necessary for her business and house needs at the same time.

loans.use: to increase her beauty products to improve her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an irrigation system

loans.name: Bubu

texts.ru: Бубу 6 лет, замужем, воспитала 7 детей, почти все дети взрослые и обустроены,только 2 из сыновей живут с ней и учатся в школе лицеи. Бубу в качестве основного дохода с 1992 году занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 1,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бубу в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 5 коров, 10 голов овец и 11 голов коз. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет 9,000  KGS  от продажи молока. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Бубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, чтобы накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Bubu is sixty years old, she is married and has raised seven children. All her children are grown adults and are well off and only two of her sons live with her and go to secondary elite schools. Bubu has been doing animal husbandry since 1992 as a main source of income, a business she started with 1,000 KGS. Because of her hard work Bubu now has five cows, ten heads of sheep and eleven heads of goats. Her monthly income from the business is 9,000 KGS from the sale of milk. With the goal to further grow her business Bubu has come to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 20,000 KGS to buy cattle. Bubu plans to invest the income from the loan into further income of her cattle volume to save money for the repair of her house.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Los Amigasos Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LOS AMIGASOS  está  compuesto por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un varón,  la presidenta del  banco es la Sra.  Cinthia tiene 18 años, tiene dos hijos de las edades de dos año y el bebe de ocho meses, ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de ropa de temporada y en esta ocasión ella vende variedad de poleras, ella vende de manera ambulante por mercados y zonas donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Cinthia va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de variedad de  poleras  por mayor y de esta manera brindar variedad de ropa  a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio ya que esta época de calor es de mucha demanda, la Sra.  Cinthia va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de ropa, la Sra.  Cinthia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: The "Los Amigasos" communal bank has nine members - eight women and one man.  The president of the bank is 18 year old Cinthia.  She has two children, a two year old and an eight month old baby.  Cinthia sells a variety of seasonal clothing and, on this occasion, she is selling polo shirts.  She is a street vendor and goes and about the market and the area offering her products.  This is Cinthia's first loan with the bank and she will use it to buy a variety of polo shirts in bulk.  She will thus be able to offer a variety of clothes to her customers and increase her profits.  She is applying for this loan so as to keep improving her business because it is the warm season and there is a lot of demand.  Cinthia will use the profits to continue to buy a variety of clothes.  Cinthia is very hard-working and is happy for the opportunity she is being given.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts in bulk.

loans.name: Belancilla

texts.en: Belancile is 58 years old. She is married and has no children. She has been in business for 37 years. Her husband is unemployed. She wants a loan to buy more thread and another sewing machine. The profit will go towards her savings.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine and thread.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 64 años y cursó la escuela primaria, tiene 6 hijos que son adultos e independientes pero que sin embargo les ayuda cuando requieren su apoyo. Está casado con Jacinta de 59 años quien se dedica a quehaceres en el hogar.  José vive con su esposa y se esfuerza trabajando duro para conseguir el sustento diario. Viven en la Parroquia de Bombolí de Santo Domingo, la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una provincia de Ecuador que en los últimos años ha tenido un alto crecimiento sostenido. Su capital  es una ciudad en donde lo más atractivo y llamativo son sus deliciosas frutas, y la gastronomía que ofrecen en el lugar. También cuenta con un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Además cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos que acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Es por esto que la mayoría de sus habitantes han emprendido con alguna actividad comercial o de servicios para habitantes y turistas.
José desde hace 8 años se ha dedicado a recorrer las largas calles de la ciudad con un coche adecuado para vender granizados que sirven como refresco para los días soleados que son muy comunes en la Región Costa a la cual pertenece Santo Domingo. El trabajo implica muchas tareas; desde recolectar en moldes grandes agua para que se congele, preparar las esencias que dan sabor al granizado y salir a vender el producto. José invierte 8 horas cada día de las cuales solo en el recorrido para la venta son 7 horas por lo general en el día antes del atardecer, horas en las que el producto es demandado. En años anteriores las personas dedicadas a este negocio recogían el hielo en la cima de algún nevado cercano y lo transportaban envuelto en porciones de paja para que no pierda su consistencia. Ahora esa costumbre se ha perdido, pero no por ello deja de ser una labor que requiera esfuerzo. En los años que José ha trabajado en esta actividad, su coche se ha desgastado y requiere algunos arreglos y repuestos, para lo cual ha solicitado un préstamo que le ayudará a realizar y estos arreglos y además en comprar algunos ingredientes para incrementar la variedad de sabores de sus granizados. El obstáculo con el que siempre ha tropezado José es la falta de capital y las dificultades para obtener un crédito. Barreras que se rompieron con Fundación Alternativa quienes gracias al trabajo de Kiva y sus prestamistas pudieron brindar a José la facilidad y confianza que esperaba.
texts.en:
Jose is 64 years old and completed primary school.  He has six children, all of whom are now independent, though he does help them when they need support.  He is married to 59 year old Jacinta who looks after the home.  Jose lives with his wife and works hard to earn a living.  They live in the Bomboli parish of Santo Domingo, the capital of Santo Domingo de las Tsáchilas, an Ecuadorean province that has had high sustained growth in the last few years.  The most attractive and eye-catching sight of the province’s capital is the delicious fruits and the local gastronomy.  There is also a considerable amount of business as it has become a trading point between the coastal and mountainous regions of the country.  It also has various tourist attractions that, along with its hot climate, are popular with national and international tourists.  For this reason, the majority of inhabitants have started up some business for inhabitants and tourists.
For eight years Jose has worked on the city’s long streets with a cart made for selling iced drinks,  a common refreshment on sunny days in Santo Domingo’s coastal region.  The work involves a lot of tasks: making ice, preparing the essences for the iced drinks’ flavours and going out to sell the product.  Jose works eight hours every day.  Seven of those hours are spent on the street selling his product, generally at dusk which is when demand for his drinks is highest.  In previous years, people working in this kind of business brought the ice from the summit of a nearby snow-covered hill, wrapped up so that it does not lose its consistency.  This tradition has now gone but it does not mean that producing the ice is any easier.  In the time that Jose has done this work, his cart has deteriorated and it needs some repairs and some parts replaced.  So, for this, he has applied for a loan that will help him with these repairs and that will allow him to buy ingredients to increase the variety of flavoured iced drinks he can offer.  The one obstacle that always trips up Jose is a lack of capital and the difficulty in getting loans.  This is an obstacle that is being overcome with Fundación Alternativa that, thanks to Kiva and its lenders, can provide Jose with the means and trust that he was hoping for.

loans.use: to fix the cart he uses to sell iced drinks.

loans.name: Los Intocables - 32 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LOS INTOCABLES – 32 está  compuesto por diez integrantes siete mujeres y tres varones,  el presidente del  banco es el Sr. Diego. tiene 24 años, soltero, el se dedica a la venta de bisutería y demás accesorios para mujeres, en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Cochabamba, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Diego va a usar este préstamo para compra de mercadería variedad de bisutería para surtir su puesto de venta,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de ampliar  y satisfacer a su clientela ofreciendo variedad de productos en su negocio, el Sr. Diego enfrenta retos en su negocio que son incrementar su clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: The communal bank "Los Intocables - 32" has ten members - seven women and three men.  The president of the bank is 24 year old Diego who is single and sells costume jewellery and other accessories for women at his stall in one of Cochabamba's markets.  This loan is his first with the bank and Diego will use it to buy costume jewellery merchandise to stock up his stall.  His reason for applying for this loan is that he needs to expand and satisfy his customers by offering a variety of products.  Diego faces the challenge of increasing his customer base and he will use the profits to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a variety of costume jewellery to stock up his market stall.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en: Julienne is 30 years. She is married with three children. The oldest is 8 and the youngest is two. Her husband is a carpenter. She has been in business for 12 years. She wants a loan to buy more fruits to sell. The profits from the business will go towards her savings.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Silvia Maria

texts.es: Doña Silvia, se gana la vida lavando ropa ajena y trabaja como empleada domestica así se esfuerza para mantener a sus 2 hijos que son menores de edad para darles los estudios y alimentación con el apoyo de su esposo, este séptimo crédito solicitado es para invertir en infraestructura, hará levantamiento de una parte de la pared de la casa y hacer muro perimetral ya que ambos están forrados de laminas de zinc, necesita comprar bloques, cemento, arena, hierro para empezar la obra y sentirse más segura y cómoda dentro de su propiedad.
texts.en: Doña Silvia earns a living washing other people's clothes and works as a cleaner in an effort to support her two children so she and her husband can feed them and provide for their education.  This is her seventh loan.  She is seeking funds to invest in infrastructure.  She will raise part of the wall of her house and build a perimeter wall.  Since both walls are covered with zinc sheets, she needs to buy breeze blocks, cement, sand, and iron to start the work.  These renovations will help her family to feel safer and more comfortable inside their property.

loans.use: to buy breeze blocks, cement, sand, and iron for building works.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine's group is comprised of hardworking women. Justine is 22 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Justine has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, milk and bread. 

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities such as milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale, and will help Justine to generate greater profits and improve her business. Justine hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business into a wholesale shop. 

Justine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more essatial commodities such as milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
San Cayetano se formo con la unión de 13 mujeres de Ciudad del Este, donde todas quieren salir adelante por medio del trabajo en equipo y ayudándose las unas a las otras. El grupo está en su cuarto ciclo y es muy unido.
Fermina es una de estas mujeres, y conforme pasa el tiempo está saliendo adelante por medio de su esfuerzo y con la ayuda de su grupo. Fermina se dedica a la venta de frutas y ya tiene muy buena clientela. Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar frutas y tener una buena variedad.
El grupo está contento por la oportunidad que recibe y está saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
San Cayetano consists of a group of 13 women from Ciudad del Este.   They all want to get ahead by working as a team and by helping each other.  The group is in its fourth loan cycle and is very unified.

Fermina is one of the group's members.  She spends her time trying to advance through her own effort and with the group's support.  Fermina sells fruit and has a good client base.  She is seeking this loan to buy fruit and maintain a good variety for resale.  

The group is grateful for this opportunity and is forging ahead.

loans.use: to buy fruit for resale.

loans.name: Al Mouna Group

texts.en:
Fatima is the featured borrower for Al Mouna's group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends, Fatima is the one in the middle. She is a 41-year-old divorced woman who spent and is willing to sacrifice her whole life replying for her children's needs.

Fatima sells clothes from her house and through visiting various customers. She is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with a special winter collection, do the necessary decoration to her house, and pay for her son's medication.
She hopes to open her own shop in the near future.

Mona is 42-year-old married woman, the mother of four children. She has been selling household appliances since 3 years ago to help her husband in making their living. She is the one on the right. Her requested loan will be invested in increasing her merchandise with newly released items.

Amira, a 64-year-old married mother of five children, has sold clothes and preserved food for eight years. Her present loan will also be used to buy a winter collection of clothes.

loans.use: to buy a special winter collection of clothes.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 41 years old. She is the mother of five children. Recently, she decided to change from her previous business to a business of selling toys. She has been in business for few months. She has a retail business. She wants a loan to buy more toys for children such as cars, planes, glasses and watches. The profit will help her raise her children.

loans.use: to buy more toys to sell.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is a 50-year-old married man and a father of 6 children; he has been selling detergents since 19 years ago. He likes his work and puts as much effort to improve and expand it as much as he can. Samir previously took a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, and he was very satisfied with the credit because he was capable of buying everything he needed.

Samir is applying for his second loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase his merchandise with newly released goods and special offers that will increase his income and improve his standard of living.

With this loan, Samir will be able to serve the increasing demands of his customers better.

In the future, he is planning to further diversify his store and attract new customers.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with newly released goods and special offers.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 28 years old. He is single. He has been in the transportation business for two years. He wants a loan to assist in repairing his motorcycle. The profit would go toward his savings.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle for use in transportation.

loans.name: Petronila Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Doña Petronila reside en la  cuidad de  Masaya, capital del Folklore Nicaragüense,  tiene 68 años, su núcleo familiar los compone ella y su esposo, tiene tres hijos que son mayores e independientes.

 La idea de  su negocio surgió como una alternativa para mejorar los ingresos de su hogar, su negocio consiste en la compra y venta de artesanía como lo es  hamacas, chinos, jarrones de barro y a la vez elabora, junto con la ayuda de una de sus hijas,  flores de tela artesanales, estos productos  los entrega en Managua por encargos ahí mantiene sus clientes fijos y que gracias al prestigio,  ha adquirido muchos mas, hasta clientes que viajan fuera del país. 
  
La señora Petronila desea un financiamiento para invertir en su negocio, por tal razón solicita un préstamo en el cual le permita  cubrir la demanda, el crédito lo utilizara para la  compra de hamacas, chinos, jarrones, y la tela para elaborar sus flores, de esta manera le permitirá seguir trabajando en su negocio y mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Petronila lives in the city of Masaya, capital of Nicaraguan folklore. She is 68 years old and her nuclear family is comprised of her and her husband and she has 3 grown children who are independent. 

The idea for her business came about as an alternative to increase the household income. Her business consists in buying and selling artisan-made crafts such as hammocks, pottery vases  that she makes with the help of one of her daughters, and artisanal fabric flowers. The products are delivered to Managua to meet orders and so she can keep loyal clients and, thanks to the prestige, has added many more including clients who travel beyond the country.

Petronila wants financing to invest in her business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan that would enable her to meet demand. The loan will be used to by hammocks, vases, and the fabric to make her flowers. In this way, she will be able to keep working in her business and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy hammocks and vases.

loans.name: Cuauhtémoc Group

texts.es: Armando tiene 42 años de edad el es casado y tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian la secundaria y primaria, el es parte del grupo Cuauhtémoc. Armando tiene un taller de elaboración y venta de lonas, hace para casas, para carros de carga, para eventos especiales, dice que últimamente también le han estado pidiendo para los viveros ya que en su región hay muchos viveros, dice que las lonas se las surten desde la ciudad de Toluca, y el las arma y cose a las medidas que se las piden sus clientes, ahorita está pidiendo un crédito para hacer crecer su negocio y espera que le vaya bien porque tiene varios pedidos y no ha podido cubrirlos por falta de material. Armando dice  que esta agradecido por el crédito que le harán por que así mejorara su negocio y tendrá lo necesario para hacer sus lonas. Los otros integrantes del grupo Cuauhtémoc se llaman Dulce, Raquel, Zerafina, Erika Jazmín, María Guadalupe, Raúl, Consuelo y María Guadalupe ellos invertirán en en insumos para hacer pan y venderlo, en ropa para vender, frutas y legumbres de temporada para vender, compra de perfumes originales, artículos para venderlos en abarrotes, en invertir en mantenimiento de un auto lavado etc.
texts.en: Armando is 42 years old and is married with 2 children who are studying in secondary and primary school. He is part of the loan group Cuauhtémoc. Armando has a workshop making and selling tarps, which he makes for houses, for cargo trucks, and for special events. He says that, lately they have been requested for nurseries as there are many nurseries in the area. He says that the fabric is supplied from the city of Toluca and that he puts the tarps together and sews them in the way that his customers request. Right now, he is requesting a loan to grow his business and he hopes that it will go well because he has various orders that he has not been able to meet because of a lack of material. Armando says that he is grateful for the loan because, with it, he will improve his business and he will have what he needs to make his tarps. The other members of the group Cuauhtémoc are called Dulce, Raquel, Zerafina, Erika Jazmín, and María Guadalupe. They will invest in supplies to make and sell bread, in clothes to sell, seasonal fruits and vegetables to sell, buying original perfumes, goods to sell in a grocery store, in maintaining a washing machine, etc.

loans.use: to buy tarps, wires, tubes to assemble tarps.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys's group is comprised of  hardworking women. Gladys is 20 years old and lives in the town of Matuga in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past 3 years, Gladys has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, milk and bread. 

To help expand her business, Gladys has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities such as milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale, and will help Gladys to generate greater profits, take care of her self and buy new clothes. Gladys hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a wholesale shop. 

Gladys is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities such as milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Juliette

texts.en: Juliette is 34 years old. She is married with three children. The oldest is 15 and the youngest is five years old. Her husband is an entrepreneur. Juliette has been in business for 15 years. She owns a retail store and wants a loan to buy more things for her store such as salt, sugar, beans and more. The profit would pay for the childrens’ school fees.

loans.use: to buy more salt, sugar, beans and more to sell.

loans.name: La Capillita Group

texts.es:
La Capillita es un grupo integrado por 5 mujeres alegre y emprendedoras cada una de ellas con una actividad economica: Herminda venta de pollo, Silvia Carniceria, Esperanza venta de abarrotes, Guadalupe venta de bisuteria y Maria Isabel taller mecanico. Este grupo esta un una zona cañera y su gente se dedica principalmente al trabajo del campo.

Doña Esperanza tiene la edad de 58 años, no estudio y esta casada con el señor Juan que se dedica al trabajo del campo,  tienen dos hijos que dependen de ellos el mayor que esta enfermo y el menor estudia. 

Ella platica que hace un poco mas de 15 años con el apoyo de su esposo puso una tienda de abarrotes en su casa con la idea de ganar su propio dinero para contribuir con el gasto de su hogar,  Ella Dijo "gracias a Dios mi negocio hay va poco a poco, es como todo siempre se vende aunque aveces baja la venta pero hay caí el dinero, este negocio no es solo mio porque yo con mis hijos lo atendemos de ahí ganamos para salir adelante".

Ella invertirá este crédito en la compra de variedad de productos enlatados, aceite, jugos, frijol, sal, arroz, sopa, azúcar, arina, dulces, refresco, Chile, tomates y cebolla para resurtir su negocio.

Ella espera a futuro su negocio siga creciendo para poder dar a su hijo la oportunidad de seguir estudiando y dar a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
La Capillita is a group comprised of 5 cheerful and enterprising women, each of whom has a business: Herminda sells chickens, Silvia has a butcher's shop, Esperanza sells groceries, Guadalupe sells costume jewelry, and Maria Isabel has a mechanics' workshop. The group is located in a sugarcane-growing area and the people there mostly work the land.

Doña Esperanza is 58 years old. She did not study and she is married to Juan, who is a farmer. They have 2 children who are dependent on them - the eldest is ill and the youngest is studying.

She says that it was a little more thant 15 years ago that, with the help of her husband, she opened a grocery store in her home with the idea of earning her own money to contribute to the household expenses. She told us "Thanks to God, my business came together little by little. Things always sell although sometimes sales are low and the income drops. This business is not only mine because I work there with my children. We are earning in order to be successful."

She wil invest the loan in buying a variety of canned goods, juice, beans, salt, soup, sugar, flour, candy, sodas, chiles, tomatoes, and onions to resupply her stores. 

She hopes that, in the future, her store keeps growing so that she can give her son the opportunity to keep studying and give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of canned goods, oil, juices, beans, salt, rice, soup, sugar, flour, candies, sodas, chiles, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: 5063-0090008238 Group

texts.en:
Benna's group is comprised of hardworking women. Benna is 19 years old and lives in the town of Mattuga in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 4 yaers, Benna has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells fresh vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Benna has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more vegetables to resell, which will help Benna generate greater profits, take care of her self and buy new clothes. Benna hopes that in the future she will be able to offer more different vegetables so as to attract more clients. 

Benna is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell.

loans.name: 5013-0090012088 Group

texts.en:
Cissy's group is comprised of hardworking women. Cissy is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past year, Cissy has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells vegetables such as tomatoes, greens and other raw foods. 

To help expand her business, Cissy has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more vegetables for resale, and will help Cissy to generate greater profits in order to pay for her house rent and for taking good care of herself. Cissy hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a bigger one. 

Cissy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 36 years old. She is married with two children. The oldest is 18 years old and the youngest is 12 years old. Her husband is a soccer coach. She has been in business for five years. She wants a loan to buy more products such as shirts, skirts, and nightgowns. She will use the profits to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more different types of attire for resale.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en: Denis is 52 years old. He is married with six children. The oldest is 17 years old and the youngest is 5 years old. His wife sells vegetables. He has been in business for five years. He wants a loan to buy more rice, sugar, beans, cassava and salt. The profit will go towards the children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 27 years old. She is married with two children. The oldest is eight years old and the youngest is two years old. Her husband is a tailor. She has started another new business where she wants to sell retail materials. With this loan, she wants to buy more materials for retail. The profit will pay school fees for the kids.

loans.use: to buy more materials for retail.

loans.name: 5013-0090012091 Group

texts.en:
Sarah's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Sarah is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, milk and bread. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities such as milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits to take good care of herself and her children. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a wholesale shop and also to open up another retail shop in town. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities such as milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.en: Alexis is 29 years old. He is married with one child who is seven months old. His wife sells fruit. Alexis has been in business for 10 years. He wants a loan to buy more shoes to sell. The profit will go towards his savings.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Bonfils

texts.en: Bonfils is 31 years old. He is married and has no children. His wife works in a hotel. Bonfils has been in business for seven years. He wants a loan to buy more spare parts for his business. The profit will go towards his savings.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Jose, como de cariño le dicen tiene 30 años de edad esta casada con Edagar desde hace 10 años y aún no tienen niños. Jose siempre ha vivido en el mismo municipio estudio la licenciatura en educacion basica, Jose y su esposo Edgar desde hace 7 años se dedican a la venta de Ropa platica que iniciaron caminando y ofreciendo de casa en casa era muy cansado para ellos porque tenian que llevar cargando sus bolsas y si algun cliente les pedia otra cosa como escargas, esferas, trastes para cocina tambien tenian que cargar con esto, Esta vez esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas ropa. Comenta que inicio su actividad porque cuando se caso su esposo decidio retomar la preparatoria y estaban construyendo su casa por lo que los gastos estaban muy elevados y de alguna manera tenian que obtener alngun dinero extra y fue como se les ocurrio vender ropa les ha ido muy bien porque ahora ya tienen sus clientes seguros, tambien pudieron comprar ya su camioneta y ya es mucho mas facil entregar sus pedidos a tiempo, Platica que no tiene ninguna dificultad hasta el momento solo cuando sus cliente no les quieren pagar a tiempo y se retrasan en sus pagos para nada grave Jose comento "Mi mayor ilusion y de mi esposo es llegar a tener un local propio donde podamos vender nuestra mercancia y los clientes nos identifiquen con facilidad y llegen a comprarnos" Anteriormente Jose y su esposo Edgar tenian un local pero oo les convenia estar pagando renta si la mayor parte del dia estaba cerrada porque no habia quien la atendiera  ya que su esposo trabajaba todo el dia y ella por las mañanas ella tenia que dar clases en una escuela.
texts.en: Jose, as she is affectionately called, is 30 years old and has been married to Edgar for 10 years and they do not have any children. Jose has always lived in the same town and she studied basic education at college. Jose and her husband Edgar have been selling clothes for 7 years. She says that they began by traveling and selling door to door and it was very tiring for them because they had to carry their bags and if a customer asked for something extra such as kitchen utensils, they had to carry this as well. This time, they are requesting a loan to buy more clothes. She comments that she started the business because, when she got married her husband decided to go back to school and they were building their house so their expenses were very high and they had to find the extra money somehow. And this is how it occurred to them to sell clothes, a business that has gone well for them because now they have loyal customers. They have also been able to buy a van so that now it is much easier to deliver their orders on time. She tells us that she hasn't had any problems to date except when a client doesn't want to pay on time and is late in their payments, but nothing serious. Jose comments that "My greatest dream, and that of my husband, is to have our own store where we can sell our goods and our customers can find us easily and come and buy from us." Previously, Jose and her husband, Edgar, had a store but it didn't make sense for them to pay rent if the store was closed most of the day because there was no one to work there as her husband was working all day and she was teaching at a school in the mornings.

loans.use: to buy more clothes such as blouses, sweaters, jackets, etc.

loans.name: Marie Antoinette

texts.en: Marie Antoinette is 26 years old. She is single. She has been in business for one year. She wants a loan to buy more candies, gum and other goods to sell.  She wants to put the profit towards her savings.

loans.use: To buy more candies, gum and other goods to sell.

loans.name: Merambu

texts.en:
Merambu is a hard-working woman. She is 16 years old, and lives in the town of Kyengera, in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past  year, Merambu has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, milk and bread. 

To help expand her business, Merambu has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities such as milk, bread, sugar, and soap for resale. It will help Merambu generate greater profits, and pay for her own school fees. 

Merambu hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business into a wholesale shop. 

Merambu is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities such as milk, bread, sugar, and soap for resale.

loans.name: Riaz

texts.en:
Mr. Riaz is 49 years old, married, and the father of four children, living with his family  in Lahore, Pakistan.  Since 2001, he has been in the business of selling milk and yogurt, which is the only source of income for his family. He purchases milk from the dairy farm, and sells it in the market.

Currently he is in need of more milk from the farm to continue his business. Due to financial constrains, he finds it difficult. 

So he has requested a loan of PKR 125,000 from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his milk and yogurt selling business, but will increase his net income and savings as well. 

He wants to provide a quality education for his children. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase milk for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy candies, snacks and other groceries for her stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an awning and chairs.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is a 53-year-old married man and the father of four children. Samir has been doing car body work specialized in painting for 40 years. He established his present business in 2007. He has built up good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Samir started working when he was 13 years old to cover his educational expenses and make his dream come true to finish his university education. He really made this come true when he graduated as a nurse. He kept on working repairing cars to fulfill his family's needs and stopped working as a nurse because he had to expand his own business.

Samir is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to do necessary maintenance on his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenance on his shop

loans.name: Kashif

texts.en:
Mr. Kashif is a 29-year-old married man and active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, living in Lahore, Pakistan. His wife is a very hardworking and responsible housewife who always helps her husband in the preparation of yogurt. Since 2000, Kashif has been in the business of selling milk and yogurt which is the only source of income for his family. He purchases milk from the dairy farm and sells it in the local market.

Currently he is in need of purchasing more milk from the farm to continue his business, but due to financial constrains he finds it difficult. For that reason, he has requested a loan amount of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his milk-selling business but will increase his net income and savings as well. He desires to provide quality education to his children. He is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase milk  for sale  in the local market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair her vehicle.

loans.name: Jonaphel

texts.en:
Jonaphel is married and has three children. Jonaphel is 30 years old and lives in Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

To earn a living, Jonaphel has a piggery. She has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns approximately 20,000 PHP. 

She requested a loan of 25,000 PHP for additional working capital to purchase feed. Jonaphel has been a member of PMPC for two years.
In the future, Jonaphel hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: for additional capital to purchase feeds.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of three grown up children from Ubay, Bohol. 

She has been engaged in a rice farming business for more than 15 years now, together with her husband. 

Lea needs a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. With this, they will be able to improve their farm and their harvest.

In the future, Lea dreams of expanding their farming business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is a dried fish vendor from Ubay, Bohol, Philippines. He has been in the business since he was a kid helping his parents. Raul is now a married man and has three young children.

Raul is asking for a loan to buy more fish for drying and to sell. In the future, Raul wants to expand his business to generate more income and revenue.

loans.use: to buy more fish for drying

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia earns a living through her retail store located in Alicia, Bohol. 

She sells various dry goods and commodities to the people in her place. This is the source of her income. Lilia works hard to  support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. 

She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks to sell like sandals and slippers, clothes, bags and accessories and others.

In the future, Lilia hopes to expand her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like sandals and slippers, clothes, bags and accessories.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of a 3-year-old son from Ubay, Bohol. 

She has run a sari-sari or variety store business for more than two years now. This is the source of her income. 

Nena is requesting a loan to buy additional materials to sell like noodles, canned goods, candies and snack foods, ospa and toiletries, soda and beverages. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store.

Nena hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional materials to sell like noodles, canned goods, candies and snack foods, ospa and toiletries, soda and beverages.

loans.name: Pableo

texts.en:
Pableo is a married man from Ubay, Bohol. 

He has been engaged in a hog-raising business for some time now. This is the source of his income. 

Pableo dreams of expanding his hog-raising venture but lacks the financial resources to do so. Pableo is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for them.

In the future, Pableo hopes to make his business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for them.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business. 

She is a a married woman and a mother of four children from Ubay, Bohol. 

Lucila wants to expand her business and needs a loan to buy additional merchandise like canned goods, bread and snack foods, noodles, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages. With this, she will be able to augment her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise like canned goods, bread and snack foods, noodles, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages.

loans.name: Mamerto

texts.en:
Mamerto is a farmer from Ubay, Bohol. He has been in the rice farming business more than 20 years now. This is the source of his income. 

Mamerto needs a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. With this, he will be able to improve the harvest from his farm.
 
Mamerto hopes to improve his farming business in the future and save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a 50-year-old farmer from Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in rice farming for several years now. Rice farming is one of the leading businesses in their place.

Marcelina is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the harvest from the farm.

In the future, Marcelina hopes to make their business a success and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business. She sells various goods and commodities to the people in her place in Alicia, Bohol.

Roberta needs a loan to buy additional stocks to sell such as canned goods, candies and snack foods, cooking ingredients, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to cater to more buyers in her store thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell such as canned goods, candies and snack foods, cooking ingredients, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Ivania Del Carmen

texts.es: Ivania una joven de 36 años, el esposo trabaja en enderezado y pintura de manera independiente con sus ingresos la poya en los gastos del hogar, tienen dos hijos de 15 y 10 años, ella ahora vende fritanga todos los días, siempre comercializa ropa nueva, cosméticos, calzado y vende productos de temporadas escolares, verano, navideño; así trabaja Ivania incansablemente y muy dinámica no se estanca con una sola cosa siempre esta innovando y viendo de donde obtener mejores ganancias para el mejoramiento de vida de la familia, sus créditos los invierte en el negocio esta vez quiere comprar variedad de ropa, calzado y cosméticos ya que tiene poco que ofrecer en su inventario, todo esto es por encargo de sus clientes, sus planes futuros es componer su casa, mejorarla poco a poco y que sus hijos se sientan bien, gracias a los crédito y el ánimo de trabajo que tiene lo podrá lograr con el pasar del tiempo.
texts.en: Ivania is a young woman of 36 years old. Her husband works in auto body work as a freelancer and with his income and he supports her with the household expenditure. They have two children aged 10 and 15 years old. Ivania now sells grilled meat every day, she always sells new clothes, cosmetics, shoes and products for the school season, summer and Christmas. This is how Ivania works: tirelessly and dynamically, she doesn't stick to just one thing, she is always innovating and seeing where larger profits can be obtained to improve the family's quality of life. She invests her loans in the business, and this time around, she wants to buy a variety of clothes, shoes and cosmetics as she has little to offer in her inventory, all on behalf of her customers. Her future plans are to repair her home, improving it little by little and that her children feel at home, thanks to the loans and the working ethic that she has, Ivania will be able to make this a reality over time.

loans.use: to buy new clothes, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Esperando En Dios 4 Group

texts.en:
Anita is the coordinator of her group Esperando en Dios (Hoping with God) 4. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding El Seybo, a poor agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their two children.

Anita is excited to be taking out her sixth loan with Esperanza after having repaid her previous loans which she successfully used to grow her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing clothes for women and men, like pants, shirts, underwear and others. She will use the profits to help her husband with the expenses in their household and to reinvest in her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Esperando En Dios 1 Group

texts.en:
Tania is the coordinator of her group Esperando en Dios (Hoping with God) 1. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding El Seybo, a poor agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their four children. 

Tania is excited to be taking out her 9th loan with Esperanza after having repaid her previous loans which she successfully used to grow her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing  underwear. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to save for her future plans. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy underwear to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Al Triunfo 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Juana is the coordinator of her group Mujeres al Triunfo (Women to victory) 1, 2 & 3 . This group is composed of 15 people and is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. Juana makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner. She says that her biggest challenge is to have savings, because with it she can reinvest, provide for her children, or to have a plan for the future.

Juana has a Pica Pollo (fried chicken restaurant), where the principal dish is chicken with fried plantains or potatoes. She has been running her business for almost four years. Using some savings, she started selling fried food. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying many pounds of chicken, plantains, potatoes, cooking oil, and other items like disposables. She will use the profits to save and reinvest in her business. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy goods for her food stall

loans.name: Ruperta

texts.en:
Ruperta is a 59-year-old married woman and a mother of six grownup children from Ubay, Bohol. She is engaged in buying and selling bananas. 

Ruperta wants to expand her retailing business but lacks the financial resources to do so.

She is asking for a loan to buy more bananas to sell in the market. In the future, Ruperta hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell in the market

loans.name: Om-Ammar Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om-Ammar and consists of five ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. All of them are responsible and are honored to be able to get a better life for their family. 

Altaf is 25 years old, a married woman with two children. She lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She works untiringly to provide sustenance for her family. Her business is embroidery, which she does for ladies for their weddings. She would like to expand her business by selling gas cylinders so that she will be able to increase her earnings. 

She is now borrowing a youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy gas cylinders. She hopes to furnish her house.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinders for resale.

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia is a farmer from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a rice-farming business for more than ten years now. 

Hermenia is asking for a loan to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the harvest from the farm.

Hermenia hopes to make her business a success in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in a pot-making business. 

She is asking for a loan to buy additional material, like clay, to make pots. With this, she will be able to make more pots and sell more on the market.

In the future, Catalina dreams of expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy additional material like clay to make pots.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of four grown up children from Ubay, Bohol. She earns a living through her food vending business selling home cooked foods to the people in her locality.

Virginia needs a loan to buy ingredients for food vending like flour, sugar, milk and butter, cooking oil and others. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more.

In the future, Virginia hopes to expand her business and save money for future use.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food vending like flour, sugar, milk and butter, cooking oil and others.

loans.name: Narjs Group

texts.en:
This group is called “Narjs” and it consists of four women from Sana`a, Yemen. They have very good experience working together and helping each other out. They applied for a loan of 170,000 YER. 

One of the members is Narjs. She is a very hardworking person who very much wants to get ahead. She is 29 years old. She comments that she always strives to the maximum to be able to help her family. She comments that she sells different types of handicrafts like embroidery and and decorative devices which are made completely by hand or by using only simple tools. She describes her business as not being enough to supports her expenses. 

She’s asking for a youth loan of 40,000 YER to buy embroidery and and decorative devices to increase her stock so as to be able to meet customer demand since she has many pending orders that she’d like to be able to fill.

loans.use: to buy embroidery and and decorative devices to increase her stock so as to be able to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa earns a living through her carenderia or eatery store which she runs from her place in Talibon, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than 12 years now. She sells home cooked foods to the people in her place.

Narcisa needs a loan. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, cooking oil and seasonings, rice and soda. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more food thus increasing her profit.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, cooking oil and seasonings, rice and soda.

loans.name: Gunduz

texts.en:
Gunduz lives in Baku region with his family. Gunduz is 49 years old.  He is married and has two children. He has been involved in transporting building materials for 11 years.
 
This is his second loan. He was very thankful to Kiva and Lenders for his first loan. But now he needs 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to repair his car and to do some repairs to his home.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike (to distribute newspapers).

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam's group is comprised of hardworking women. Mariam is 21 years old and lives in the town of Matuga in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Mariam has been working hard to manage her farming. 

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase seeds such as maize and beans for planting, and will help Mariam to generate greater profits and pay half the school fees for her children. Mariam hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house and improve her family's stardard of living. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase seeds such as maize and beans for planting

loans.name: Riungu

texts.en:
Riungu lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He owns a tea tree farming business. He started the business from the income of subsistence farming. The extract from the tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics. He began the business of tea tree farming this year. 

He learnt about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group and he joined the group with an aim of accessing credit. The main challenge in the area has been the seasonal weather. This he believes will be sorted once he purchases a water pump.

Riungu is applying for a loan of 22,022 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. His extra income from the loan will be added to the savings and he looks forward to establishing the farming by increasing the acreage.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He owns a tea tree farming business. He started the business from the income of subsistence farming. The extract from the tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics. He began the business of tea tree farming this year. 

He learnt about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group and he joined the group with an aim of accessing credit. The main challenge in the area has been the seasonal weather. This he believes will be sorted once he purchases a water pump.

Timothy is applying for a loan of 10,440 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings and he looks forward to establishing the farming by increasing the acreage.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Tarcela

texts.en:
Tarcela is a 67-year-old married woman and a mother of four grown-up children. They live in the province of Bohol, in the Philippines. Tarcela has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for several years now. This is the source of their income.

Tarcela is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, fish hooks and lead weights and fuel for the boat. With this, they will be able to enhance their catch thus augmenting the number of fish they sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, fish hooks and lead weights and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. They live in Ubay, Bohol, Philippines. Teresa has run a sari-sari or variety store business for more than20 years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Teresa is applying for a loan to buy additional stock to sell in her store like canned goods, candies, snack foods, noodles, soap, shampoo and toiletries, soda and beverages. With this, she will be able to improve her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her store like canned goods, candies, snack foods, noodles, soap, shampoo and toiletries, soda and beverages.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa earns a living through her food vending business. She has been in it for more than two years now. She sells home cooked foods to the people in her place in Valencia, Bohol. Josefa is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, rice and seasonings. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, rice and seasonings

loans.name: Ma. Nova

texts.en:
Ma. Nova runs an eatery in her place in Valencia, Bohol. This is the source of her income. Ma. Nova is applying for a loan to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, rice, seasonings and others. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more.

In the future, Ma. Nova hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to continue supporting the schooling of her two children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, rice, seasonings and others

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 50 years old and married with six children, four of his children are school-going. He is a peasant farmer involved in cattle rearing and growing coffee and sugarcane. David has been practicing agriculture for the last 20 years and it is the major source of income for looking after the family and paying school fees for his children. His clients are residents of his village and from the outskirts of Kagadi town who buy his milk and sugarcane.

David wants a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy more cows for rearing as well as improving on the sugarcane and banana plantation. He is always challenged by the changing weather conditions that affect his agricultural business.

David's dream is to educate his children up to higher institutions of learning and help him in the future. He also hopes to buy a machine which will help him add value to his sugarcane, for example brewing it into local gin. But his wish is to see the lender availing him with financial services to have his dream come true.

In the photo, the second person to the left is the Ugafode officer.

loans.use: To buy cows and also improve his sugarcane and banana plantations.

loans.name: Al-Saeeda Group

texts.en: This group is called Alsaeeda, made of 5 ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Saeda is 47 years old. She became the only responsible person to take care of her family. She has been selling fabrics and incense door-to-door. When she heard about AMB, she immediately applied for a loan of 40,000 YER to help her keep going on her job and to buy some more stock.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and incense for resale.

loans.name: Moain Group

texts.en:
This group is called Moain. It consists of four women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They took out a loan of 100,000 YER. 

Amal is the president of this group. She is 30-year-old, married woman and has three children who live in Sana`a, Yemen. She is a housewife. She requires a youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to buy home appliances for her house.

loans.use: to buy home appliances for her house.

loans.name: Sarfraz

texts.en:
Mr. Sarfraz is a 25-year-old married man. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. His wife is a very hardworking and responsible house wife. Since 2010, Sarfraz has been trading buffalo which is the only source of income for the family. He purchases buffalo from the farm and sells them at the market.

Currently he is interested in purchasing a buffalo to grow his business but due to financial constrains he finds it difficult. For that he has requested a loan amount of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his trading business but will increase his net income and savings as well. He desires to provide quality education to his children. He is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a buffalo.

loans.name: Al-Yosr Group

texts.en:
This is the Al-Yosr group. The group is made up of four members who live in Sana`a, Yemen. 

Habaya is a 52-year-old. She lives in Sana`a, Yemen, and characterizes herself as being a very hardworking woman. She applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy a washing machine. She hopes to own a house one day.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine for personal use.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
Maria, 42 años de edad, originaria de Estelí, casada, madre de 1 hijo de 21 años, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería de la que es propietaria hace mas de 2 años. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio con capital propio, dinero que su marido le dio para establecer su propio negocio de pulpería en su casa, este ha sido su primer negocio, sus expectativas es ampliar su negocio, con productos que aun no tiene en inventario.
Ella esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar arroz, azúcar, gaseosa, etc. Toda la mercadería en general mas solicitado por sus clientes, ya que ella estima que este préstamo le será de gran ayuda a seguir creciendo como   una pequeña empresaria, sus planes futuros es ampliar su pulpería en una miscelánea y establecer una tienda de ropa, con el propósito de aumentar su  inventario con productos novedosos.
texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old. She is from Estelí, and is married and the mother os a 21 year old son. She works as a merchant, selling groceries from a store she has owned for 2 years. She started in this type of business with her own capital, money her husband gave her to set up her own business. She hopes to expand her business with products she doesn't stock yet.   

She is asking for a loan to buy rice, sugar, soda, etc. All of them are the merchandise her customers demand the most. She estimates the loan will be a big help to keep growing as a small businesswoman. Her future plans are to expand her store with a variety section and set up a clothing store to increase her inventory with new products.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, soda, etc.

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en: Onesmus is a repeat borrower of Ugafode. He narrates: "I joined Ugafode in 2012 when I wanted a loan to buy land. I was given the loan and bought the land. I was able to start the construction of my school/nursery which I hope to open this year. I want this loan to expand the land on which I built the nursery and construct toilets. I would like to extend my sincere appreciation to the management and Ugafode as an institution for the support given to us which has enabled us to accumulate income and assets."

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to construct a pit latrine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Isabel Monserrate

texts.es: ISABEL  vive en las orquídeas. tiene49 años. es soltera .Ella Toma la decisión de buscar trabajo y Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa ella  decide  juntar dinero  para dar apertura  a su negocio de venta  de comida rápida  en general  En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  una clientela  Isabel  trabaja en su negocio  diariamente , ella se dirige a su trabajo a las 6 am de la mañana. Con el préstamo comprara  congelador, varios, etc. su meta es poner un negocio en el centro de la ciudad para tener más ingresos y poder mejorar su negocio.
texts.en: Isabel lives in Las Orquídeas, she is a single 49 year-old. She decided to find work but as no-one gave her the opportunity to work in a company, she decided to raise money to open her own fast-food business. As it stands, her business grew little by little attracting customers, Isabel works in her business every day, she runs her business from 6:00 am. With the loan, she will buy a freezer and so on. Her aim is to set up a business in the city center to obtain a larger income and be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo Encarnación surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes y actualmente se encuentra en su ciclo numero 10. Ellas comentan que pese a las dificultades se encuentran más que firmes en seguir trabajando y luchando por sus familias.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Sebastiana, ella tiene su propia despensa, tiene 2 hijos está casada con el señor Nicolas quien es Agricultor, ambos se ayudan y están saliendo adelante gracias al sacrificio y al gran esfuerzo que hacen por dar a sus hijos todo lo que se merecen.
Cuenta la Sra. Sebastiana que el crédito solicita para la compra de productos para su despensa, como ser verduras, hortalizas, carne y demás.
texts.en:
This group from Encarnación came about after contact was made by one of the members. At present the group is on its 10th loan cycle. The women comment that despite difficulties, they are more than determined to continue working and fighting for their families.

One of the members is Sebastiana. She has her own grocery store. She has 2 children and is married to Nicolas, who is a farmer. They help each other and are doing well thanks to the sacrifice and great effort that they put in to their work. Their aim is to give their children everything they deserve.

Sebastiana says that she is requesting the loan to buy products for her store, such as greens, vegetables, and meat, etc.

loans.use: to buy greens, vegetables and meat etc.

loans.name: Sadick

texts.en:
Sadick is a single man aged 25. He has two dependents (a sister and a brother) who live with him. He operates a retail shop in Kagadi town at the same time as working as a sales agent for MTN Uganda in the same area.

Sadick started this business in 2010 after dropping out of school due to lack of tuition fees and in order to look after his poor parents. He wants a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (two million shillings) to complete his residential house which is currently under construction.

The major challenge for Sadick is the limited funds for the business since it is the only source of income for his daily expenses, funding the house construction and also taking care of his aged parents.

He hopes that the lenders will always avail them of funds whenever the need arises.

loans.use: To complete his residential house.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
En el distrito de Santiago, distrito caracterizado por  sus grandes paisajes de color verde debido a la agricultura que se desarrolla en la zona, vive Victor, un hombre muy trabajador y de condición humilde que poco a poco ha ido saliendo adelante a pesar de las adversidades, sobre todo porque vive al lado de su esposa y de sus 3 maravillosos hijos y por ello Victor daría la vida y su sacrificio diario es por darle las oportunidades que él no tuvo. Es así que cada día el trabaja como obrero en un fundo agrícola ubicado en su distrito, el labora alrededor de 8 horas al día pero cuando hay campañas de cultivo trabaja algunas horas mas y con ello tener un ingreso extra; el  cree que está saliendo adelante en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y cuidadoso con su trabajo.

Victor está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda ya que poco a poco la ha ido construyendo de material noble, aun le falta construir cuartos y techarla, así el podrá  mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir cada día trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena profesión a sus hijos y ver su casa terminada completamente”.
texts.en:
In the district of Santiago, a district characterized by its vast green landscapes with the agriculture in the area, lives Victor. He is a very hardworking and humble man who little by little has been getting ahead despite adversity. He lives with his wife and their 3 wonderful children and Victor would give his life for them and his daily sacrifice is to give them the opportunities that he didn't have. That is why every day he works as a laborer at a farm located in his district. He works around 8 hours a day but when there are plantings he works extra hours to have some more income. He believes that he is getting ahead in his work because he is very responsible and careful at his work.

Victor is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have given he will be able to do some home improvements since little by little he has been building it out of bricks. He still has to build rooms and put on a roof. This way, he will be able to improve his and his family's quality of life and keep working every day to make his biggest dream come true: "give his children a good education and see his house be completely finished."

loans.use: to do home improvement.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains such as rice and corn by the 100 kg sack.

loans.name: Las Maravillosas Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LAS MARAVILLOSAS  está  compuesto por ocho integrantes todas mujeres,  la presidenta del  banco es la Sra. SANDRA  tiene 28 años y es casada con 3 hijos que son de las edades de  4, 9 y  11 años, ella se dedica a la venta de marcos de madera,  tiene su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de el Torno, este préstamo es la primera secuencia dentro de la institución, Sandra  va a usar este préstamo Para la compra de marcos de madera por mayor para vender al detalle , y así de esta manera  aumentar su capital de trabajo para su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es  surtir su negocio, Sandra  va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar electrodomésticos para su casa y así  dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, la Sra. Sandra es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo ya que en muchos casos es la única actividad que les permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Las Maravillosas” (“The Wonderful Women”) has eight members, all women. The president of the bank is Sandra. She is 28 years old and is married with 3 children, who are 4, 9 and 11 years old. She sells wooden frames and has a stall in the El Torno area. 

This is the group’s second loan cycle with the institution. Sandra will use the loan to buy wooden frames at wholesale to sell retail. In this way she can increase her business’s working capital. Her reason for requesting the loan is to stock up her business. Sandra will use the profits to buy electrical appliances for her home. This will enable her to improve her family’s quality of life. 

Sandra is a very responsible and hardworking person. She is happy and grateful to the institution for the support that she and the other members of the group receive, as often these businesses are the only activity they have to support themselves.

loans.use: to buy wooden frames

loans.name: Ruhiyya

texts.en:
Ruhiyya is 32 years old. She is married and has two children. 

Ruhiyya lives in the Baku region with her husband and children. She has been in the agriculture business for four years. She has increased the number of cows. She sells milk products to a special shop.

Now Ruhiyya needs 2,000 AZN to buy calves to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 34 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, José no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, José trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
José se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de la instalación de los servicios higiénicos y desagüe en su vivienda, de esta manera José brindara mayor seguridad, higiene y bienestar para él y su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción total de su vivienda.
texts.en:
José is 34 years old and he lives in the city of Ica, in the district Santiago, with his wife and two small children,  who he loves and are his reason for living. He is a very friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person and dedicates all of his energy in improving life for his family. Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources and because he needed to work to cover living expenses, José could not study a professional career in Mechanical Engineering, but he would have liked to. In his free time, he likes to watch television and on occasion he cooks a delicious dish, called Tallarines, for his family. 

On his own initiative, and through much hard work and determination, José has worked in the fields for a farming business in his city. He works every day from the early morning and for at least 8 hours a day. He is happy to do his work and believes that everything is going well because of his good performance and for the kind way he treats everyone else. 

José is very grateful for the lenders at Kiva, and thanks to the help that they offer him, he will be able to cover the cost of installing a bathroom and a drain in his home. This will help him bring more security, hygiene and well-being to him and his family and so he will be able to continue to work hard to achieve his dream of finishing the construction on his home.

loans.use: cover the costs of installing bathrooms and a drain.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a mat weaver from Valencia, Bohol. She has been engaged in the mat weaving business for more than ten years now. 

Amalia is asking for a loan to buy materials for mat weaving like romblon (native palm), nylon and straw. With this, she will be able to weave more mats.

In the future, Amalia hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy materials for mat weaving like romblon (native palm), nylon and straw.

loans.name: Jesus Alberto

texts.es: Jesús es cliente Kiva, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la siembra de hortaliza, originario de Estelí, el se  siente satisfecho con su tercer préstamo porque le fue de gran ayuda ya que pudo invertirlo en su siembra obteniendo buenos rendimiento y calidad de su cosecha, incrementado sus ventas y de esta manera pudo obtener mejores ganancias, utilizo su tercer préstamo en la compra de insumo y pago de mano de obra para cultivar tomate, ya que la demanda de sus productos de hortalizas ha ido creciendo. Es por este motivo que está solicitando un crédito Kiva,  para comprar de insumo, fertilizantes, abonos y pago de mano de obra para sembrar ½ manzana de repollo y una  manzana de maíz para vender, ya que el considera que obtendrá buenos rendimientos de su cosecha y se lo pagaran a un buen precio, su siguiente paso es ampliar el área de siembra.
texts.en:
Jesús is a Kiva client and dedicates himself to vegetable farming. He is from Estelí, and is very pleased with his third loan because it was of great help to him. He was able to invest it during planting season, obtaining good crop yields and quality, thus increasing his sales and making a greater profit. He used his third loan to buy supplies and to pay for labor to cultivate tomatoes, since the demand for his vegetables has been growing. 

It is for this reason that he is asking for a loan from Kiva, to buy supplies, such as fertilizers, and to pay for labor to sow half an acre of cabbage and an acre of corn to sell, since he believes that he would be able to obtain good yields on these vegetables and could sell them at a good price. The next step would be to increase the area that he uses to sow his vegetables.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as fertilizers, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Junior Alfredo

texts.es:
